The *Offering to the Merciful Honored Ones, the Two Emperors, and the Ten Kings* proceeds in due course, or the *Post-Rite Offering* may commence. The Daoist assembly gathers in the *Hall of Azure Radiance*. The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Step-in-Emptiness*, and the *Supervisor of the Zhai* oversees the offering procession, declaring, “With utmost reverence, we now make our petition.” Next, the Daoist assembly divides into left and right ranks, each member in turn inviting the Ten Kings, ascending from the lowest. With sincere devotion, they petition:

“May the *True Lord of Vast Simplicity of the Fengdu Palace* deign to depart the nether realms and attend this humble feast, partaking of the vegetarian offering and bestowing compassionate deliverance. May the gentle winds and cloud chariots convey you to this Dharma assembly.”

The High Priest kneels to petition the underworld. Next, the *Eastern Peak* and the *Great One* are invited according to the ritual protocol. The High Priest announces:

“Having humbly made our petition, the *Merciful Honored Ones, the Two Emperors, and the Ten Kings* have graciously descended to the offering seat. With utmost sincerity, we now present incense.”

The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Flower-Scattering Ritual*, and the assembly circumambulates, clustering around the censer. The Keeper of the Bell chants, “Let each be reverent.” With sincere devotion, they bow and pay homage:

“To the *Boundless Great Dao of the Supreme*,
To the *Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerated Scriptures*,
To the *Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center*.”

The offering proceeds as prescribed. The Announcer recites the *All-Fruitful Fields Mantra*, and the Keeper of the Bell chants the *Jade Sound Ritual* for the offering. The High Priest re-enters the ritual protocol, declaring, “With utmost reverence, we now perform the *Rite of Faith*.” The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Rite of Faith*. With sincere devotion, they take refuge and pay homage:

“To the *Azure Sovereign of the Eastern Ultimate*,
To the *Benevolent and Sacred Emperor of the Eastern Peak*,
To the *Mysterious Heavenly Great Emperor of Fengdu*,
To the *Ten Kings of the Nether Realms*.”

The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Homage to the Feet*, and all prostrate with utmost sincerity, confessing their transgressions. The High Priest, holding the censer, kneels in repentance as the Keeper of the Bell chants the *Step-in-Emptiness*. Next, the *Three Petitions* and *Three Homages* are performed. The Announcer declares, “Diligently cultivate the great Daoist rites.” The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Hymn of Rising from Seats*. The Announcer recites the *Memorial and Petition*. The High Priest re-enters the ritual to send off the sagely presence. The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Hymn of Returning to the Plow* and the *Hymn of Sagely Virtue*. The *Burning Offering* is made. The Announcer delivers the *Dedication* of the preceding rites.

The Offering to the Three Treasures, the Various Heavens, the Nine Heavens, and the Thirty-Two Heavens is presented during the *Refinement and Liberation* ritual before noon. The Daoist assembly gathers at the *Hall of Heavenly Offerings* or within the ritual arena, where the *Lector* presides over the procedures. The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Step-in-Emptiness*, the High Priest recites the *Water Petition*, and the Keeper of the Bell chants the *Water Response*. Next, the *Incense Petition* is recited, followed by the *Incense Response*. The High Priest, in full ritual attire, invokes the sagely presence and declares the *Offering to Heaven*. Holding the censer, he kneels to invite the Three Treasures:

With utmost sincerity, he petitions:
*Celestial Treasure Lord of the Qingwei Heaven*, may you deign to illuminate the assembly hereafter—thus do all, with unified intent, bow in reverence to the *Supreme Orthodox and True Three Treasures*.
With utmost sincerity, he petitions:
*Divine Treasure Lord of the Yuyu Heaven*—may you deign to illuminate the assembly hereafter—thus do all, with unified intent, bow in reverence to the *Supreme Orthodox and True Three Treasures*.
With utmost sincerity, he petitions:
*Spiritual Treasure Lord of the Great Red Heaven*—may you deign to illuminate the assembly hereafter—thus do all, with unified intent, bow in reverence to the *Supreme Orthodox and True Three Treasures*.

Next, one representative from the assembly proceeds to the left and right ranks, inviting each deity in ascending order:
With utmost sincerity, they petition:
*Emperor of the Infinite Heaven of Yushan within the Nine Heavens*, may you temporarily depart your celestial palace and descend to this mortal feast, witnessing the offering of this pure repast and bearing witness to our liberation.
May your cloud chariot and wind steeds arrive at this Dharma assembly.

The High Priest, in full ritual attire, presents the offering as the Keeper of the Bell chants the *Scattering Flowers*, and the assembly circumambulates to present the offerings. Next, each participant demonstrates reverence:
With utmost sincerity, they bow in reverence to the *Supreme and Boundless Dao*.
With utmost sincerity, they bow in reverence to the *Thirty-Six Venerable Scriptures*.
With utmost sincerity, they bow in reverence to the *Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm*.
The offering is made according to ritual propriety.

The Announcer declares the *Mantra of All Merit Fields*, and the Keeper of the Bell chants the *Ritual of Offering*. The High Priest enters the ritual space and, with utmost care, performs the *Act of Faith and Reverence*. The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Act of Faith and Reverence*:
Faith and reverence to the *Supreme Great Luo Heaven*, *Celestial Treasure Lord of the Qingwei Heaven*.
Faith and reverence to the *Supreme Great Luo Heaven*, *Divine Treasure Lord of the Yuyu Heaven*.
Faith and reverence to the *Supreme Great Luo Heaven*, *Spiritual Treasure Lord of the Great Red Heaven*.
Faith and reverence to the *Supreme Great Luo Heaven*, *Emperor of the Nine Heavens Who Gives Birth to Spirits*.
Faith and reverence to the *Supreme Great Luo Heaven*, *Thirty-Two Heavenly Lords*.

The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Homage to the Feet*, and all prostrate with utmost sincerity, confessing their transgressions. The High Priest kneels in repentance as the Keeper of the Bell chants the *Step-in-Emptiness*. Next, the *Three Petitions* and *Three Homages* are performed. The Announcer declares, “Diligently cultivate the great Daoist rites.” The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Hymn of Rising from Seats*. The Announcer recites the *Memorial and Petition*. The High Priest re-enters the ritual to send off the sagely presence. The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Hymn of Returning Chariot* and the *Hymn of Sagely Virtue*. The *Burning Offering* is made. The Announcer delivers the *Dedication* of the preceding rites.

**Lighting the Lamps**
The Daoist assembly gathers before the Two Masters. The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Step-in-Emptiness*, and the High Priest kneels to petition for the *Ritual Staff*. The High Priest then takes the staff and recites the incantation. The incense attendant chants the *Hymn of China*, leading the assembly in circumambulation around the lamp altar. The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Heavenly Worthy of Illuminating Light*. Next, they chant the *Assembly of the Three Pure Realms of Ultimate Bliss*.

The Keeper of the Bell chants:
*Within the Jade Clarity Palace, the Primordial Lord of the Origin governs*—thus harmonize with the *Great Sage, Heavenly Worthy of the Origin*.
The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Assembly of the Three Realms’ Carefree Paths*.
Next, they chant:
*Within the Supreme Clarity Palace, the Lord of the Dao transforms*—thus harmonize with the *Great Sage, Heavenly Worthy of the Numinous Treasure*.
The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Assembly of the Three Islands’ Penglai Paths*.
Next, they chant:
*Within the Grand Clarity Palace, the Lord Lao presides*—thus harmonize with the *Great Sage, Heavenly Worthy of the Dao and Its Virtue*.

The Announcer invokes the sagely presence and enters the ritual to announce the talisman. The High Priest consecrates the talisman and, holding the banner, recites the gatha. The Announcer chants the *First Day Lamp Ritual*, and the assembly recites the liturgical texts and repentance for the *Ritual of the Youthful Attendants*. The repentance texts are recited for the *Second Hell Ritual*. Next, the gatha is chanted. The attendant holds the staff as the High Priest, beginning from the *First Day Lamp*, breaks open the *First Hell* down to the *Blood Pool Hell*. The High Priest burns the talisman and sprinkles water, employing the incantation and mudra for breaking open the hells as prescribed. Only after the *Blood Pool Lamp* has broken the *Nine Dark Hells* is the *Blood Pool* itself broken. Following the established form, the ritual proceeds through the ninth segment. The High Priest retrieves the *Talisman of Returning Light and Transforming Form*, along with the *Form of Fengdu* and the *Form of the Blood Pool*, burning them upon the bamboo slip. He then gathers the ashes into a ball, clasping it between his hands. The High Priest presses his tongue to his upper palate, transforming into the *Dharmakāya of the Primordial Origin*, silently reciting the *Numinous Scripture* once. He visualizes the *Treasure Light of the Heavenly Worthy* illuminating all within and without with boundless radiance. Drawing in the *qi* of the ancestors, he blows the ashes into the diagram of the *Lamp Hell*. The assembly circumambulates the lamp altar, reciting the *Vast Fengdu* and other incantations. The incense attendant chants the *Hymn of China*, escorting the ritual staff back before the Two Masters. The High Priest kneels to return the staff. The Keeper of the Bell chants the *Dedication of the Preceding Rites*. The Announcer delivers the *Dedication*.

*End of the Second Scroll of the* **Jade Mirror of the Numinous Treasure**
*Beginning of the Third Scroll of the* **Jade Mirror of the Numinous Treasure**

The **Gate of the Numinous Banner and Treasure Canopy**
*Sequence for Salvation, Rescue, and Healing*

The assembly bathes and dons transformed robes, then performs morning audience rites with incantations and ritual meals. The Daoist throng gathers at the **Altar of the Divine Tiger**. The Keeper of the Bell intones the *Step-in-Emptiness* liturgy; the High Priest and officiating officials present incense. The High Priest performs the purification rite.

Next, he transforms into his divine form, strides the **Divine Tiger’s Constellation**, summons the palace generals, and the Announcer presents the *Threefold Offering Text*. The High Priest then dispatches the talismans of the **Three Primordial Capitals**. The banner is led to the summoning site, where the Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Great Compassionate Guide-and-Receive Heavenly Worthy**. The assembly joins the High Priest in purification, performing the *Rite of Opening the Path*.

The purpose of the fast is declared, and the Announcer recites the *Hymn of Fragrant Water*. The *Hymn to the Dipper* is sung, followed by the Announcer’s chanting of the *Verse of the Great Tenuous Yellow Banner of the Supreme Subtlety*. The assembly responds with the *Verse of Inconceivable Merit*. The *Verse of the Nine Heavens’ Mandate of Numinous Power* is chanted, followed by the *Verse of Talismanic Command Penetrating the Dark Void*.

The Announcer performs the *Threefold Summons*, inviting the position of the **Rightly Delivered Deceased**. Next, the position of the **Attached and Recommended Deceased** is summoned, followed by the **Universal Deliverance of the Six Directions**, the **Six Paths**, and the **Twenty-Four Classes of Lonely Spirits**. The Keeper of the Bell intones the *Heavenly Worthy’s Exposition of the Scriptural Teachings*, leading the banner to the **Bureau of Supervising Births**.

The Keeper of the Bell conducts the liturgy, and the Announcer invites the **Sacred Position of the Present Altar**. The altar attendants offer tea and wine. The Keeper of the Bell conducts the liturgy, and the High Priest invokes the deities to enter the rite, performing the requisite actions. The assembly recites the *Hymns to the Five Emperors*, then burns the talismans according to the prescribed form.

The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Great Compassionate Guide-and-Receive Heavenly Worthy**, leading the banner to the **Jade Clarity Hall of Purging Filth**. The Announcer invites the **Sacred Position of the Present Altar**, and tea and wine are offered in the liturgy. The High Priest enters the rite, performing the requisite actions, while the assembly recites the *Vast Purgation Incantation of the Dragon Han*, then burns the talismans according to the prescribed form.

The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Great Compassionate Guide-and-Receive Heavenly Worthy**, leading the banner to the **Court of Heavenly Physicians**. The Announcer invites the **Sacred Position of the Present Altar**, and tea and wine are offered in the liturgy. The High Priest enters the rite, performing the requisite actions. The assembly recites the middle section of the *Numinous Scripture*, and the present altar uses a dose of the **Tenfold Complete Elixir**, prepared in advance and administered when the altar is passed. The High Priest burns the talismans, sprinkling them within to rescue and heal the deceased souls.

Next, the High Priest performs the *Rite of the Five Offices’ Affairs*. The **Five Emperors’ Complete Form Talismans**, the **Five Directions’ Qi Formulas**, and the **Uniting of Qi** are employed according to the prescribed method. The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Great Compassionate Guide-and-Receive Heavenly Worthy**, leading the banner to the **Bathing Site**, where the *Hymn to the Supreme Mysterious Divine Water* is proclaimed. A liturgist recites the *Bathing Rite*. The assembly recites the *Bathing Incantation*.

As per the liturgical instructions, the Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Great Compassionate Guide-and-Receive Heavenly Worthy**, leading the banner to the **Robing Site**. Next, the **Heavenly Worthy of Divine Transformation and Wondrous Function** is invoked. A member of the assembly declares the *Robing Text*. The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Heavenly Worthy of Divine Penetration and Self-Mastery**. The *Robing Incantation* is proclaimed, and the assembly recites the middle section. The Keeper of the Bell intones the *Heavenly Worthy’s Exposition of the Scriptural Teachings*, leading the banner before the **Three Treasures**.

The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Three Clarities and Three Treasures Heavenly Worthies**, and the Announcer recites the *Text of Audience before the Three Treasures*. The Keeper of the Bell intones the *Hymn of Audience before the Three Treasures*. Next, the **Great Compassionate Guide-and-Receive Heavenly Worthy** is invoked, leading the banner to the **Altar of Right Deliverance**, then to the **Altar of Attached Deliverance**, and then to the **Altar of Universal Deliverance**. The assembly divides into ranks, proceeding to each spirit’s altar to recite incantations and offer ritual meals.

Next, the banner of lonely spirits is led to the **Judgment Cauldron of the Reed Enclosure** for relief. Each night, the High Priest performs the *Five Kitchens Scripture* incantation and the *Nine Meals Talisman Rite*. The sequence for offering ritual meals and refining the lonely spirits follows.

The assembly gathers at the **Judgment Feast**. The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Heavenly Worthy of Vast Deliverance from the Depths**, and the assembly responds. The High Priest ascends the seat, offers incense, invokes the deities, states the purpose, and enters the rite. The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Heavenly Worthy of Universal Brightness of Sun and Moon**.

The High Priest declares: *"We reverently invoke the Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity of the North Culmen to descend the water."* He then dispatches the *Talisman for Establishing the Water Pool*, recites the *Incantation of the Great Yin’s Containment and Transformation*, the *Talisman for Inviting True Water*, the *Incantation for Refining with Yin Qi*, the *Talisman of the Moon’s Essence*, the *Incantation of the Moon’s Fullness in the Square*, the *Twelve River Sources Talismans*, and the *Incantation for Awakening the Radiance of Yellow Essence*.

The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Heavenly Worthy of Universal Brightness of Sun and Moon**. The High Priest declares: *"We reverently invoke the Great Emperor of Longevity of the South Culmen to descend the fire."* He then dispatches the *Talisman for Establishing the Fire Pond*, recites the *Incantation of the Lord of the Southern Quarter*, the *Talisman for Inviting True Fire*, the *Incantation for Washing the Soul with Yang Qi*, the *Talisman for Casting Fire Ten Thousand Li*, the *Incantation for Receiving Life in the Sun’s Center*, the *Talisman of the Sun’s Essence*, and the *Incantation of the Cinnabar Scenery of the Red Crucible*.

The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Heavenly Worthy of Boundless Deliverance of Humanity**. The High Priest enters the *Judgment Cauldron Rite*, performing the *Twenty-Four Talismans of Dispersing and Transforming* and the *Talisman for Resolving Grievances*. The assembly follows the *Dispersing and Transforming Rite*, responding with the invocation of the Heavenly Worthy.

The High Priest re-enters the rite. The assembly circumambulates the cauldron, reciting incantations to transform the meal. The High Priest performs the visualization of transformation. He enters the rite again, while the assembly recites scriptures and delivers admonitory dharma teachings. The *Nine True Precepts* are conferred, talismans and registers are bestowed, the *Merit Certificate* is proclaimed, and the High Priest consecrates the talismans.

The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Heavenly Worthy of Ninefold Radiance and Refinement**, burns the talismans to summon the functionaries, and dispatches the *Talisman for the Water-Commanding General*, the *Talisman for Entering Water and Refining*, the *Incantation of Vast Holding without Mirror*, the *Incantation of the Lord of the Northern Quarter*, the *Talisman for Purging the Form*, the *Incantation of the Yellow Qi’s Yin Splendor*, the *Talisman for Water-Refining the Blood Corpse*, the *Primal Origin’s Talismanic Command for Delivering the Bright and Luminous*, and the *Incantation for Withered to Flourish Anew*.

The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Heavenly Worthy of Cinnabar Refinement in the Fire Realm**, summons the *Talisman for the Fire-Commanding General*, and the High Priest declares the text. The Keeper of the Bell invokes the **Heavenly Worthy of Jade Pupils Refining the Substance**, burns the *Fire-Refining Talisman*, recites the *Incantation of the Southern Darkness and Floating World*, the *Incantation of the Lord of the Southern Quarter*, the *Talisman for Refining the Substance*, the *Incantation of the Supreme One Refining the Form*, the *Talisman for Fire-Refining the Blood Corpse*, the *Incantation of Jade Pupils Refining the Substance*, the *Incantation of Qi Transforming into a Person*, the *Incantation of Golden Liquid Refining the Form*, the *Four Talismans of the Yang Essence’s Cinnabar Method*, the *Incantation of Yang Concealing and Yin Arising*, the *Talisman for Reuniting Qi and Restoring the Bones to Raise the Dead*, silently recites the *Numinous Scripture*, the *Brahma Qi Talisman*, the *Great Brahma Qi for Boundless Deliverance of Humanity*, the *Talisman for Returning the Substance*, the *Incantation of Jia Yi Bing Ding*, the *Talisman for the Five Spirits’ Fusion*, the *Incantation of the Seven Qi’s Perfection into the True*, the *Talisman for Immortal Transformation into a Person*, and the *Incantation for the Dead Soul’s Reception of Refinement*.

The High Priest summons the escorting generals, and the Announcer proclaims the document.

Next, the *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Golden Portal’s Transformation-Body Heavenly Worthy*. The High Priest enters the ritual sequence.

Next, descending from the seat, the soul is escorted forth, and the incense is burned in offering. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Return to the Origin*. The Announcer performs the *Turning of Merit*. The *Recitation of Goodness* follows.

**First Day of the Proper Ritual Sequence: Morning Audience and Procession of the Dao**
The Daoist assembly gathers in the Master’s Hall. The Master of Rites invites the Ritual Patron to offer incense and perform three bows. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Incense Grove’s Exposition of the Dao Heavenly Worthy*. The High Priest ascends the seat, offers incense, and expounds the Dao. Next, the *Narrative of Gratitude* is recited, and the High Priest descends. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Jade Clarity’s Purification Heavenly Worthy*. The Precentor leads with a single chant of the *Purification Incantation*, and the assembly responds. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Golden Perfection’s Exposition of the Teaching Heavenly Worthy*, followed by three chants in unison. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Hymn of Huaxia*. The *Purifier* carries the water vessel, proceeding to sprinkle and cleanse. The *Incense Attendant* leads the ranks to the main altar before the *Canopy of the Transcended*. A Dharma Master delivers the ritual address, inviting the spirit to attend the audience. The *Banner-Bearer of the Direct Altar* follows the ranks. Next, proceeding to the *Canopy of the Presiding Master*, the Master of Rites guides the Ritual Patron to offer incense before the canopy and perform three bows. The High Priest offers incense and presents the memorial. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Hymn of the Dao*, followed by the *Hymn of Huaxia*. The *Incense Attendant* leads the ranks in circumambulation, burning incense until arriving before the *Celestial Throne*, where the curtain is drawn. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Jade Capital’s Radiant Splendor Heavenly Worthy* in unison. Next, the Announcer proclaims the *Curtain-Drawing Document*. The High Priest kneels, activates the talisman, and performs the *Curtain-Drawing Rite* as the *Knower of the Bell* intones. Next, the *Knower of the Bell* intones the *General Audience of the Celestial Emperor Heavenly Worthy*.

Next, the *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Veneration of the Jade Clarity’s Title*, and the High Priest offers incense at the *Jade Clarity Censer*. Next, the *Veneration of the High Clarity’s Title* is intoned, and incense is offered at the *High Clarity Censer*. Next, the *Veneration of the Grand Clarity’s Title* is intoned, and incense is offered at the *Grand Clarity Censer*. The *Knower of the Bell* continues, intoning the *Hymn of Huaxia*, and incense is burned. The *Incense Attendant* and *Knower of the Bell* lead the High Priest forward. Next, the Precentor arrives at the *Capital Gate* and enters the *Earthly Portal*. The High Priest enters the portal with an incantation. Proceeding in order to the altar, the assembly stands in formation. The High Priest offers incense to the East and presents the memorial to the East. The remaining directions follow likewise. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Veneration of the Lofty Nine Dark Heavens*, and the assembly responds with the *Celestial Worthy of the Numinous Treasure of the East*. For the South: *Heaven of the Three Qi*. For the West: *Heaven of the Seven Qi*. For the North: *Heaven of the Five Qi*. For the Northeast: *Heaven of Brahma Qi*. For the Southeast: *Heaven of Brahma Qi*. For the Southwest: *Heaven of Brahma Qi*. For the Northwest: *Heaven of Brahma Qi*. For the Above: *Heaven of the Twelve Qi*. For the Below: *Ninefold Layered Darkness*. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Inaugural Ode of the Hall*, and the High Priest offers incense at the *Cave Table*, silently reciting the incantation. The High Priest visualizes and activates the talisman, then returns to position and kneels before the censer. The Ritual Patron offers incense and performs three bows. The Precentor leads the *Veneration of Each Master*, and the High Priest proclaims the *Guardian Spirit Incantation*. The Precentor intones, and the *Dharma Drum* is sounded. Next, the High Priest *Opens the Censer*. The Precentor intones, and the *Dharma Drum* is sounded again. The High Priest *Emerges in Official Capacity*. This may conclude with the first audience’s emergence or extend through the ninth audience’s emergence. The Precentor intones, and each declares their ritual rank. The High Priest states his position and *Invokes the Sages to Enter the Ritual Sequence*. Two members of the Daoist assembly proceed before the *Celestial Throne* to pour libations, while three *Reciters of Repentance* proclaim the liturgy. The Master of Rites invites the Ritual Patron to offer incense, perform three bows, and kneel. The High Priest re-enters the ritual sequence and *Pinches the First Incense*. The *Incense Attendant* first exits the ranks to offer incense to the East, South, West, and North. The Precentor next exits the ranks to offer incense at the *Jade Clarity Imperial Censer*. The High Priest offers incense at the *Cave Table*. Next, the *First Pinched Incense Talisman* is burned, and the visualization is performed. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *First Pinched Incense Ode*, and the assembly responds. The Master of Rites invites the Ritual Patron to offer incense. The High Priest intones the *Chapter of the Demon Kings: "The Dao of Humanity Is Vast"*, and the assembly responds. The High Priest re-enters the ritual sequence and *Pinches the Second Incense*. The *Incense Attendant* offers incense to the Northeast, Southeast, Southwest, and Northwest. The Precentor offers incense at the *High Clarity Imperial Censer*. The High Priest offers incense at the *Cave Table*. The *Second Pinched Incense Talisman* is burned. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Second Pinched Incense Ode*, and the assembly responds. The Master of Rites invites the Ritual Patron to offer incense again. The High Priest intones *Lofty and Boundless*, and re-enters the ritual sequence to *Pinch the Third Incense*. Next, the *Incense Attendant* offers incense to the Above and Below. The Precentor offers incense at the *Grand Clarity Imperial Censer*. The High Priest offers incense at the *Cave Table*. The *Third Pinched Incense Talisman* is burned, and the visualization is performed. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Third Pinched Incense Ode*. The Master of Rites invites the Ritual Patron to offer incense three times. The High Priest intones *Above the Three Realms*. The High Priest enters the ritual sequence to *Harmonize with the Dao and Merge with the True*. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Celestial Worthy of the Numinous Treasure of the East*, and the assembly responds. Next, the Master of Rites invites the Ritual Patron to proceed before the *Celestial Worthy of the East*, offer incense, perform one bow, and kneel. The *Incense Attendant* and *Knower of the Bell* lead the High Priest to the East to offer incense, bow, and kneel. Next, the *Knower of the Bell* intones the *General Chant of the East*, and the *Reciters of Repentance* kneel to recite the *Eastern Repentance*, invoking the various spirit officials to *Harmonize with the Dao and Merge with the True*. The four directions begin with the East, followed by the four corners beginning with the Northeast, then the Above and Below, all in proper order. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Three Clarities and Three Treasures Heavenly Worthy*. The High Priest proceeds to the left, standing before the *Ghostly Portal* facing West, while the Precentor proceeds to the right, standing before the *Celestial Gate* facing East. Each visualizes the nine-colored circular image, its light illuminating the ten directions, swallows saliva to command the demons, and recites the secret incantation. Next, the High Priest recites the secret incantation. The Precentor intones, and the assembly circumambulates in *Step of Emptiness*. This may conclude with the daily noon audience’s demon-commanding rite, if desired. The *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Nine Yang Songs* in unison. The *Hymn of Huaxia* is intoned, and the ranks return to formation. Alternatively, flowers may be scattered during the three daily audiences’ circumambulation.

In the first circuit, the *Bowing in Reverence to the Most High* is intoned, and the final phrase is chanted in unison with the *Voice of Goodness*. In the second circuit, the *Treading of Cloud Steps in Procession* is intoned, passing through the towering peaks as the *Celestial Capital’s Mountain* is chanted as one verse. In the third circuit, the *Bowing and Rising* is performed while visualizing the *Most High*. The remaining six verses are divided between the noon and evening audiences, completing ten verses in a single day. Next, the Precentor intones the *Title of the Scripture*, and the *Knower of the Bell* intones the *First Inaugural Ode*. The Precentor intones *With Devoted Heart, Bow in Reverence to the Most High, the Boundless Great Dao*, and the *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Second Inaugural Ode*. Next, the *With Devoted Heart, Bow in Reverence to the Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures* is intoned, and the *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Third Inaugural Ode*.

Next, the Precentor intones *With Devoted Heart, Bow in Reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center*, and the *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Jade Talisman, the Heavenly Worthy Who Absolves Transgressions*.

The High Priest kneels and petitions, invoking the Jade Tablets of the Heavenly Official, the Earthly Official, and the Water Official, while the Reciter announces the tablets. The High Priest recites the incantations for each tablet, summons the generals, and the Reciter reads the memorials. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Dispatching Talisman Incantation, the Golden Radiance of Merit and Virtue*. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Heavenly Worthy of Great Unity, Savior from Suffering*.

In unison, the High Priest kneels and petitions, requesting to bow to the memorial of the Heavenly Worthy of Great Unity. The Announcer proclaims the memorial. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Hymn of Burning the Memorial*. The Reciter reads the memorials.

Next, the Precentor intones the recitation of the Dharma ranks once more. The High Priest enters the ritual section to express gratitude. The *Knower of the Bell* and the *Knower of the Bell Chime* strike the metal and jade instruments in alternation. The Precentor intones the *Twelve Vows*. Next, the *Visualization of the Spirit While Burning Incense* is intoned, the High Priest returns to the incense burner, and the *Hymn of Exiting the Hall* is chanted.

Next, the Attendant at the Incense Burner leads the assembly in a circuit, proceeding to exit the altar. The High Priest collects the memorial tablets and descends from the altar. Upon entering the altar, the High Priest leads; upon exiting, the Attendant at the Incense Burner leads, proceeding in order to the Master’s tent. The High Priest offers incense and kneels in gratitude. The Master of Ceremonies invites the Director of the Retreat to offer incense and perform three bows. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *Thus Far*, and the Announcer performs the *Dedication*. The Precentor intones the *Supervision of the Retreat and Correction of Transgressions*, and the Supervisor of the Retreat approaches the Master’s tent to offer incense and make a report.

The Banner Attendant leads the banners back to the tents in formation, and the Daoist assembly chants scriptures and performs the dedication. The Attendant at the Incense Burner leads the assembly to the Master’s hall, where the High Priest and the Director of the Retreat offer incense. Next, the *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Hymn of Taking Refuge in the Supreme Dao*. Next, the *Morning Petitions Concluded* is intoned. The officials return to their positions.

**Noon Audience of the First Day**
The order of the audience follows the same pattern as the morning audience. The High Priest recites the ritual section, proceeding to the first pinch of incense. The Incense Attendant offers incense, beginning from the South, then the West, the North, and the East. For the second pinch of incense, from the Southeast, Southwest, Northwest, and Northeast. For the third pinch of incense, from the Upper Realm and the Lower Realm. The High Priest recites the ritual section, proceeding to *Uniting with the Dao in Perfection*. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Heavenly Worthy, Supreme Minister of the Eastern Flowery Realm*. Next, the *Eastern Marchmount* is intoned in unison. The Reciter kneels and recites the *Repentance to the Eastern Marchmount*, then intones *The Heavenly Worthy Who Refines in the Southern Palace*.

Next, the *Southern Marchmount* is intoned in unison, and the Reciter kneels and proclaims the *Repentance to the Southern Marchmount*. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Heavenly Worthy, Protector of Virtue in the Western Numinous Realm*. Next, the *Western Marchmount* is intoned in unison, and the Reciter kneels and recites the *Repentance to the Western Marchmount*. Next, the *Heavenly Worthy, Supreme Inspector of the Northern Origin* is intoned, followed by the *Northern Marchmount* in unison, and the Reciter kneels and proclaims the *Repentance to the Northern Marchmount*. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Heavenly Worthy, August Emperor of the Central Yellow*, followed by the *Central Marchmount* in unison, and the Reciter kneels and proclaims the *Repentance to the Central Marchmount*. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Heavenly Worthy Who Pacifies and Stabilizes the Five Numinous Powers*, and the assembly returns to their positions. The Precentor intones the *Ritual for Subduing Demons*.

Next, the *Three Clarities and Three Treasures, Heavenly Worthies* is intoned, followed by the *Ten Hymns of Pacing the Void in the Jade Capital*. For a three-day, nine-audience retreat, when the *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Three Clarities and Three Treasures, Heavenly Worthies*, the assembly exits in order, circling the altar evenly and coming to a halt. Next, the Precentor intones the *Pacing the Void in Circuit*. Next, the *Knower of the Bell* intones *Bow in Reverence to the Most High*, and at the final verse, the assembly chants in unison the *Auspicious Sound* and each performs one bow. Next, the *Pacing the Void While Treading the Cloud Steps* is intoned, and the altar assembly rises to tread the *ding* steps of the *Gang* pattern, proceeding slowly. At the final verse of each hymn, the assembly chants in unison the *Auspicious Sound* and performs one bow.

For a single-day, three-audience retreat, at the noon audience, the *Controlling the Reins to Visit the Ten Directions*, *The Great Dao’s Master in Mysterious Quiescence*, and *The Garden of Rounded Scenery in the Forest of Soaring* are intoned as three hymns. Upon returning to their positions, the *Hua Xia* is used, and they come to a halt only after standing still. The rest follows the established pattern. After the *Three Inaugural Odes and Three Bows*, the High Priest petitions the *White Memorials and Talismanic Commands for the Nine Dark Realms* and the *Jade Tablets and Talismanic Commands for the Nine Dark Realms*. The High Priest bows to the memorial of the *Heavenly Worthy Who Embraces Transgressions in the Nine Dark Realms*. All follows the pattern of the morning audience.

**Evening Audience of the First Day**
The High Priest recites the ritual section, proceeding to the first pinch of incense. The Incense Attendant offers incense, beginning from the North, then the East, the South, and the West. For the second pinch of incense, from the Northwest, Northeast, Southeast, and Southwest. For the third pinch of incense, from the Upper Realm and the Lower Realm. Next, the *Repentance to the Five Stars* is performed. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Heavenly Worthy of True Light Illuminating the Caverns*. Next, the *Palace of the Sun* is intoned in unison, and the Reciter proclaims the *Repentance to the Palace of the Sun*. Next, the *Heavenly Worthy of Radiant Wisdom Illuminating* is intoned, followed by the *Palace of the Moon* in unison, and the Reciter proclaims the *Repentance to the Palace of the Moon*. Next, the *Heavenly Worthy of Flowing Radiance Shining* is intoned, followed by the *Palace of the Stars* in unison, and the Reciter proclaims the *Repentance to the Stars*. Next, the *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Heavenly Worthy of the Cavernous Samadhi*, followed by the *Palace of the Water Bureau* in unison, and the Reciter proclaims the *Repentance to the Palace of the Water Bureau*. Next, the *Heavenly Worthy of the Perfected Scripture Treasure* is intoned, followed by the *Palace of the Scripture Treasure* in unison, and the Reciter proclaims the *Repentance to the Scripture Treasure*. The *Knower of the Bell* intones *The Heavenly Worthy of the Supreme Jade Capital*, and the assembly returns to their positions. The Precentor intones the *Ritual for Dispelling Demons*, and the *Knower of the Bell* intones the *Three Clarities and Three Treasures, Heavenly Worthies*. Next, the *Nine Hymns of the Yin Songs* are intoned.

For a three-day, nine-audience retreat, at each morning audience, the *Nine Yang Hymns* are intoned, and at each evening audience, the *Nine Yin Hymns* are intoned. At each noon audience, the *Ten Great Pacing the Void* hymns are intoned. The beginning and ending procedures for the morning and evening audiences are the same as the *Ten Great Pacing the Void*. For a single-day, three-audience retreat, at the evening audience, the *Palace of the Heavenly Perfected Emperor* is intoned: *Adorning My Nine-Dragon Chariot, Perfect and Unattached in Truth*, completing ten hymns across the morning, noon, and evening audiences.

The High Priest petitions the *Golden Tablets of the Divine Empyrean* and the *Jade Tablets of the Divine Empyrean*, and bows to the memorial of the *Heavenly Worthy Who Vastly Delivers the Submerged*. The rest follows the established pattern.

**Morning Audience of the Second Day**
The Incense Attendant burns incense, and the Reciter recites the repentances for the directions, following the same pattern as the morning audience of the first day. The High Priest petitions the *Talismanic Commands of the Jade Tablets of the Three Heavenly Lords of the Upper Origin* and requests to bow to the memorial of the *Heavenly Worthy Who Delivers Lives in the Vermilion Mound*.

**Noon Audience of the Second Day**
All follows the same pattern as the noon audience of the first day. The High Priest petitions the *Golden Writs and Vermilion Scripts of the Precious Proclamations of the Nine Heavens of the Middle Origin* and requests to bow to the memorial of the *Heavenly Worthy of the Great Bridge of the Dharma*.

**Evening Audience of the Second Day**
All follows the same pattern as the evening audience of the first day. The High Priest petitions the *True Talismans of the Perfected Who Ascend to Transcendence, Liberating from the Cycles of Birth and Death* and requests to bow to the memorial of the *Heavenly Worthy, Sacred King of the Turning Wheel*.

**Morning Audience of the Third Day**
All follows the same pattern as before. The High Priest petitions the *Precious Proclamations of the Great Yang for Refining Form* and requests to bow to the memorial of the *Heavenly Worthy of the Cinnabar Realm of Fire Refinement*.

**Noon Audience of the Third Day**
All follows the same pattern as before. The High Priest petitions the *Jade Scripts of Thunder Patterns* and the *Longevity Memorial Texts*, and requests to bow to the memorial of the *Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Portal’s Transformation Body* and the *Memorial of Refinement through Water and Fire*.

**Evening Audience of the Third Day**
All follows the same pattern as before. After the *Three Invocations and Three Bows*, the High Priest petitions the *Precious Proclamations of the Great Yin for Refining Form* and the *True Talismans for Erasing Death and Ascending to Life*.

The rituals of the nine audiences follow the same pattern throughout, except for the repentance talismans and memorials. From the first to the third day, after each evening audience, the scripture attendants perform the *Lamp Rite for Gathering and Offering*.

After the morning audience of the third day, the Precentor and the assembly proceed to the *Celestial Offering Hall* to present offerings to the *Three Treasures and the Nine Heavens*, and conduct the ritual of offering to the *Sages of the Myriad Heavens* as prescribed.

After the eighth audience, the High Priest and the assembly, in accordance with the rites, present the *Texts of Thanksgiving for Blessings Received*. Following the subsequent evening audience—or after each morning audience of the three days—the imperial meal is offered. The detailed procedures are recorded separately.

**Conclusion of the Audience and Distribution of Alms**

In the *Hall of Assembled Masters*, the High Priest offers incense. The Ritual Director invites the *Fast-Officer* to offer incense and perform three bows. The *Bell-Master* intones the invocation to the *Jade Clarity Heavenly Worthy of Dispelling Filth*, and the Precentor recites the *Dispelling Filth Mantra*. The *Bell-Master* then intones the invocation to the *Golden Perfected Heavenly Worthy of Expounding the Teachings*. The assembly responds in unison three times. The incense attendants lead the ranks out of the altar space, circumambulating while offering incense, and proceed to the *Master’s Tent*. The High Priest makes a formal announcement, and the *Bell-Master* intones the chant. The incense attendants, led by *Song Huaxia*, guide the ranks to offer incense upon the altar. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Opening Hall Hymn*, and the Precentor leads the assembly in paying homage to the masters. The High Priest recites the *Guardian Spirit Mantra*. The Precentor strikes the *Dharma Drum*, and the High Priest kindles the incense burner. The drum is struck again. The officials then exit, and their ritual positions are announced. The High Priest enters the ritual protocol to invoke the presence of the sages. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Invocation of the Ten Directions’ Heavenly Worthies*. The *Bell-Master* then leads the assembly in bowing to the feet of the Worthies, each making sincere repentance. The Precentor guides the assembly in the *Ten Directions’ Seated Repentance*, and the *Bell-Master* intones the *Three Invocations and Three Bows*. The *Bell-Master* intones the invocation to the *Azure Radiance First Elder Heavenly Worthy*. The High Priest proceeds to the east, and the Ritual Director guides the *Fast-Officer* to the east to perform two bows, holding the incense burner and kneeling. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Eastern True Writ*, and the assembly pays homage to the master in gratitude. The High Priest recites the prayer of gratitude for the *True Writ*. The same procedure is followed in the south, west, north, and center. The High Priest then proceeds to the central incense burner, recites the prayer and mantra for the *True Writ*, and burns it. The assembly chants the *Golden Dragon* in response, and the *Four Tones of Pacification* are intoned as all return to their ranks. The Precentor announces the ritual positions again, and the High Priest re-enters the ritual protocol to recite the *Repentance and Liberation of the Altar*. The *Announcer* reads the memorial, and the *Bell-Master* intones the *Burning Memorial Hymn*. The High Priest performs the *Submission Rite* as prescribed, and the assembly responds in unison to the *Green Memorial* as directed. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Cloud Stairway Step Chant*. The High Priest re-enters the ritual protocol to make an announcement. The Ritual Director invites the *Fast-Officer* to offer incense and perform three bows. The *Bell-Master* intones the invocation to the *Heavenly Worthy of Repaying Virtue*. The High Priest recites the prayer four times, inviting the assembly to bow and present the *Memorial of Merit*. The *Announcer* reads the memorial aloud. The High Priest purifies the memorial with incense and then submits it. The *Announcer* reads the memorial’s conclusion, and the memorial is burned. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Burning Memorial Hymn*, and the assembly responds with the *Memorial Text* as directed. The *Bell-Master* intones the invocation to the *Three Clarities and Three Treasures Heavenly Worthies*. The High Priest recites the prayer to invoke the *Three Memorial Tablets*. The *Announcer* reads the *Mountain Tablet*. The High Priest recites the *Tablet Mantra*, then reads the *Water Tablet* and recites its mantra, followed by the *Earth Tablet* and its mantra. The assembly then pays homage to the *Three Treasures*. The High Priest declares:

*"Time flows swiftly, the sun’s shadow shifts unseen.
The Dao accords with the Primordial,
Its grace blankets the great earth.
The imperial realm endures,
The sage’s longevity spans the heavens."*

The assembly responds with bows of reverence, taking leave of the *Dao-Treasures of the Ten Directions*. The jade chimes fall silent, the sacred talismanic smoke dissipates. The masters return to the *Great Clarity*, illuminating the long night. The *Three Paths* cease their opposition, the *Six Realms* halt their turning wheels. The assembly responds with bows of reverence, taking leave of the *Scripture-Treasures of the Ten Directions*. May all beings refrain from evil, practice all virtues, avoid karmic entanglements, and abide in prosperous times. May all sentient beings realize the *Unconditioned*. The assembly responds with bows of reverence, taking leave of the *Master-Treasures of the Ten Directions*. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Returning Carriage Hymn*, and the High Priest descends to post the *Eight Gates’ Placards*. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Descending Altar Hymn*, followed by the *Twelve Vows*. The Precentor then leads the *Spirit-Preserving Incense Offering*, and the High Priest rekindles the incense burner. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Exiting Hall Hymn* and the *Extinguishing Lamps Hymn*, and the altar lamps are extinguished in order. The incense attendants lead the ranks down from the altar to stand in sequence before the *Six Tents*. The High Priest and the *Fast-Officer* offer incense. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Respectful Devotion of Each Participant*. The High Priest delivers the prayer of gratitude. The *Announcer* reads the *Memorial of Mystic Gratitude*. The *Six Tents* join the High Priest in offering a universal prayer of gratitude. The Precentor leads the *Universal Penance of the Fast-Supervisor*, and the *Fast-Supervisor* kneels to report the universal penance. The Precentor instructs the officials to kneel in unison and return the precepts as prescribed. The High Priest delivers the admonition for returning the precepts. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Returning Precepts Hymn*, and the Precentor leads the officials in submitting their ranks. The *Announcer* collects the *Rank Tablets*. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Hymn for Sending Off the Six Tents*, followed by the *Cloud Chariot Hymn* and the *Sending Off the Masters Hymn*. The *Bell-Master* intones the invocation to the *Heavenly Worthy of Turning the Light and Returning the Carriage*, escorting the true masters back to the *Hall of Assembled Masters*. The *Fast-Officer* offers incense and performs the bows. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Fourfold Concluding Vows*. The officials offer their thanks in order.

---

**Transmission of Precepts and Bestowal of Registers**
The Daoist assembly gathers at the *Hall of Proper Attainment*. A master in ritual vestments delivers the invocation to invite the *Spirit Banner*. The *Announcer* chants the verse, and the altar attendant holds the banner aloft. The *Bell-Master* intones the invocation to the *Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion and Reception*, welcoming and inviting the *Banners of Attachment and Deliverance*. The general altar is set at the western edge, with the *Soul Banner* positioned. The High Priest’s seat is arranged at the eastern edge. The High Priest delivers the ritual address, indicating the seat. He then ascends the seat, offers incense, expounds the Dao, and strikes the ritual ruler to enter the protocol. The *Bell-Master* intones the invocation to the *Dao, Scriptures, and Masters Heavenly Worthies*. The assembly responds in unison as the High Priest rises, holding the incense burner to invite the *Three Treasures and Five Masters* to witness the transmission of precepts. The High Priest re-enters the ritual protocol. The *Bell-Master* intones the *Respectful Devotion of Each Participant*, followed by the *Hymn of Bowing in Refuge to the Dao, Scriptures, and Masters*. The High Priest re-enters the protocol, and the *Bell-Master* intones the *Wisdom Hymn*, followed by the invocation to the *Heavenly Worthy of Compassionate Precept-Teaching*. The High Priest strikes the *Dharma Ruler* and expounds the *Nine Wondrous Precepts of the Perfected*, then intones the *Receiving Precepts Hymn*. The various grades of *Talismans and Registers* are then conferred. The *Announcer* reads the *Precept Certificate* and the *Merit Certificate*. The High Priest recites the general *Talisman Mantra*. The High Priest delivers the ritual address and descends from the seat.

**Severing the Corpse and Delivering the Households through Refinement**
The *Bell-Master* intones the invocation to the *Heavenly Worthy of Flying Deliverance through the Five Households*. The *Fast-Officer* holds the *Proper Attachment-Deliverance Bridge*. The High Priest performs the ritual with sword and sprinkled water. The *Announcer* reads the *Memorial for the Three Corpses’ Talisman*. The High Priest invokes the spirits of the *Three Corpses*. The *Announcer* recites the *Prayer for the Three Corpses’ Talisman*. The *Announcer* recites the *Verse for Delivering the Households*, leading the banner through the *Five Gates of Suffering*. At each gate, the ritual verse is recited, delivering the banner to the *Refinement Altar*. Silver coins are then arranged in the shape of the *Dipper* on the ground—a total of forty-nine coins, with seven coins in each of the seven piles. The High Priest, from *Wei* to *Kui*, performs the ritual with the *Jade Seal*. The assembly recites the *Returning Spirit Mantra*, and the *Seven Qi* coalesce into perfection.

The High Priest next announces the *Talisman for Resolving Grievances*, and the assembly proceeds together to the *Refinement Altar*. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to commence the ritual. One set of ritual robes is prepared for the *Three Offerings of Refinement*. The High Priest requests and bows to the *Memorial for the Nine Heavens’ Refinement*, and the *Announcer* reads the *Memorial for the Refinement*. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to recite the *Hymn for Burning the Memorial*, then reads the *Petition for the Refinement* before burning it. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Nine Radiance Refinement Heavenly Worthy*, while the *Purification Attendant* holds the basin to sprinkle purification water. The assembly circumambulates the altar, reciting the *Purification Mantra*.

The High Priest ascends the seat, offers incense, and invokes the deities to enter the ritual. He requests and bows to the *Memorial for Water and Fire*, and the *Recitation Attendant* reads the memorial. The High Priest prostrates with the memorial, the *Announcer* reads the *Official Document*, and the *Announcer* strikes the chime to recite the *Hymn for Burning the Memorial*. Next, the *Universal Radiance of Sun and Moon Heavenly Worthy* is invoked.

The High Priest holds the water basin, steps the *Dipper Pace*, and harmonizes the *qi*, then casts the talisman into the water pool. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to recite *With Sincere Heart, We Take Refuge and Bow in Faith*, addressing the *Great Yin Sovereign of the Moon Palace*. Next, the *Incantation for Gazing Across the Eight Directions* is recited, followed by *Juewu Ziyu*, summoning the *Great General of the Water Lord*. The *Document for the Water Lord General* is cast. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Universal Radiance of Sun and Moon Heavenly Worthy*. The High Priest holds the censer, steps the *Dipper Pace*, and harmonizes the *qi*, then casts the talisman into the fire pool. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to recite *With Sincere Heart, We Take Refuge and Bow in Faith*, addressing the *Great Yang Emperor of the Sun Palace*. Next, the *Incantation for Gazing East to Fusang Palace* is recited, followed by *Nanyan Dongfu*, summoning the *Great General of the Fire Lord*. The *Document for the Fire Lord General* is cast.

The *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Nine Radiance Refinement Heavenly Worthy*, then recites the *Hymn for Spreading the Seat*. The priest supplicates: *"I humbly invoke the Nine Radiance Azure Gold Western Han Lady, the Primordial Sovereign Golden Mother of the Great Realized, to descend with true qi and infuse the Flowery Pond."* The *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Wondrous Fruit and Pure Moon Heavenly Worthy*. The *Water Talisman* is conferred, and the *Yellow Crystal Illumination Incantation* is recited, followed by the *Incantations for Descending Water Talismans* in sequence.

The priest supplicates: *"I humbly invoke the Primordial Yang Compassionate Father, Fusang Great Emperor, Lord of the Wooden Duke, to descend with true qi and illuminate the divine court."* Next, the *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Compassionate Radiance of the Vermilion Sun Heavenly Worthy*. The *Fire Talisman* is cast, and the *Red Furnace Cinnabar Radiance Incantation* is recited, followed by the *Incantations for Descending Fire Talismans* in sequence. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Heavenly Worthy Who Delivers the Infinite*.

The High Priest enters the ritual. *"I have heard that the Infinite Deliverer, the Great Sage of Longevity..."* Next, the *Ten Directions’ Flying Heavenly Spirit Kings* are summoned to oversee the deliverance and protection, and the *Four Protections* are recited. The *Four Guardians* are united, the *Official Document* is read, the *Day-Official Merit Clerk* is summoned, and the generals are called to guide the souls to the *Water Refinement*.

The *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Heavenly Worthy of Unfettered Spiritual Power*, and the banner is moved to the edge of the water pool. The High Priest enters the ritual, and the *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Yellow Flower Purifying Form Heavenly Worthy*. The *Water Lord General* is summoned to perform the *Water Refinement*, and the *Water Refinement Talismans* are cast in sequence, followed by the *Nine Water Rebirth Talismans*. The *Union* is performed. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to recite the *Verse of the Eastern Well and Yellow Flower Pool*. Next, the incantations are recited in order.

The banner is then moved to stand by the fire pool. The High Priest enters the ritual, and the *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Heavenly Worthy of Jade Eyes Refining Essence*. The *Fire Lord General* is summoned to perform the *Fire Refinement*, and the *Fire Refinement Talismans* are cast in sequence, followed by the *Nine Fire Rebirth Talismans*. The *Union* is observed. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to recite the *Verse of the Southern Supreme Vermilion Mansion*. Next, the incantations are recited in order. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Heavenly Worthy Who Gathers the Realized and Restores the Spirit*.

The High Priest re-enters the ritual, rises, holds the banner, and performs the *Intertwined Refinement Method*, reciting the *Heaven One Generates Water Incantation* three times. The banner is then burned in the fire. As the form burns in the furnace, the true *qi* is reborn. The *Transcendent Banner* is exchanged and erected beside the *Qi-Gathering Furnace*, signifying rebirth and renewal.

The High Priest enters the ritual and burns the *Eighteen Great Cavern Talismans*, harmonizing the *qi* with each talisman. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Heavenly Worthy of Returning Form and Transformation*. The High Priest re-enters the ritual, then invokes the *Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Portal’s Transformation*. Next, the *Three Clarities and Three Treasures Heavenly Worthies* are invoked. The *Nine Chapters’ Talismans*—three sets of nine—are presented, with the assembly reciting one *Heavenly Chapter* for every three talismans. The *Announcer* strikes the chime to invoke the *Heavenly Worthy of the Nine Qi Generating the Spirit*. The *Five Spirits’ Union Talisman* and its incantation are recited, followed by the *Jade Infant’s Spirit Transformation Talisman* and its incantation. The *Transcendent Transformation into Human Talisman* and its incantation are recited.

The *Yellow Register of Dao Transmission* is conferred, and the *Great Ascension Mantra* is recited. The High Priest performs the *Ascension and Deliverance Method*, the *Wisdom Hymn*, and sends off the souls. He descends from the seat, takes leave of the *Three Treasures*, sends off the deities, and summons the *Five Directions’ Divine Lads* to board the chariot. The *Verse of Crossing the Bridge* is recited, the *Three Chapters of the Demon Kings* are chanted, and the offerings are burned. The *Merit* is recited, and gratitude is expressed.

The ritual concludes as the assembly gathers in the master’s hall.

The Precentor intones the *Jade Clarity Venerable of Purging Defilements*. Next, the Cantor recites the *Purging Defilements Mantra*. The Precentor then intones *Each Attendant Reverently Submits*. Following this, the *Master of the Retreat* leads the *Hua Xia* procession, guiding the assembly in circumambulation while offering incense. The *Incense-Burning Hymn* is intoned, and the Cantor leads the assembly in paying homage to the master. The High Priest recites the *Guardian Spirit Mantra*. The ritual drum is sounded, the incense burner is kindled, and the drum is struck again to summon the officiants. The Cantor leads the assembly in declaring their ritual ranks, and the High Priest invokes the deities, proceeding to the *Invitation Rite*.

Two Daoist officiants divide into left and right ranks, ascending in alternating order to request the presence of the deities along the corridor. The High Priest offers the prayer: *"All Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions, the Hosts of the Three Realms, array your immortal ranks to reverently welcome the Imperial Chariot."* The *Yellow Path Mantra* is recited. Next, the assembly kneels and prostrates to petition the *Four Masters and Four Emperors of the Divine Empyrean*.

The Precentor intones the *Great Clarity Melody* to invite the *Great Clarity*. The Precentor intones the *High Clarity Melody* to invite the *High Clarity*. The Precentor intones the *Jade Clarity Melody* to invite the *Jade Clarity*. The *Cloud Chariot Hymn* is recited, and the High Priest offers the prayer: *"The Three Clarities descend in their chariots, the Four Emperors attend in state. We humbly invite the hosts of the Three Realms to array their ranks in homage. The rites of homage now complete, each spreads the feast of offering. With utmost sincerity, we present the first incense."* The Precentor intones the *Scattering Flowers*, and the assembly circumambulates to the incense burner before the grotto altar. The High Priest and the Retreat Master offer incense, while the Direct Attendant presents tea and pours wine. The Precentor intones the *Long Chant of Ritual Affairs* before the burner.

The Cantor leads the assembly in declaring their ritual ranks once more, and the High Priest proceeds with the rite, reciting the *Petition and Repentance Texts*. The High Priest dispatches the officiants. Next, the *Fumigation Mantra* is recited, followed by the *Step Pace and Prostration Petition*. The Precentor intones the *Fumigation Hymn*, and the High Priest proceeds with the rite for the *Second Offering*. The *Second Offering Ritual* is performed, and the High Priest proceeds with the rite. For the *Third Offering*, the Announcer reads the *Memorial and Petition Documents*. The Precentor intones the *Third Offering Ritual*, and the High Priest, with renewed sincerity, presents the final petition before proceeding to the *Rite of Sending Off the Deities*.

Next, the Precentor intones the *Return Chariot Hymn*, followed by the *Yellow Path Mantra*. The Cantor leads the *Meditation and Incense Offering*, and the High Priest rekindles the incense burner. The Precentor intones the *Venerable of Perfect Treasure’s Completion*, guiding the assembly to the burning site. The Precentor intones the *Hymn of Sagely Virtue*, and the assembly returns to their original positions. The Announcer performs the *Merit Transfer*. The officiants express their gratitude.

**Release of Living Beings Rite**
The assembly gathers before the altar, and the Precentor intones the *Step Pace Chant*. The Announcer invokes the deities and proceeds with the rite. Next, the *Venerable of Life-Preserving Destiny* is intoned, and the Announcer recites the *Release of Living Beings Mantra*. The *Petition Document* is read, followed by the intoning of the *Venerable of Carefree Joy*. The Announcer recites the mantra again. The *Petition Document* is read, followed by the intoning of the *Venerable of Boundless Blessing*, and the Announcer recites the mantra once more. The *Petition Document* is read, and an officiant in ritual vestments delivers the *Release of Living Beings Invocation* before performing the release. The assembly recites scriptures, and the Precentor intones the *Return Chant*. The Announcer performs the *Merit Transfer*, the *Fourfold Aspirations* are made, and the officiants disperse.

*Lingbao Yujian*, Scroll Three—Concluded
*Lingbao Yujian*, Scroll Four

The Gate of Divine Banners and Precious Canopies

When one allies with Heaven and petitions Earth, summons the perfected and invokes the numinous, radiates luminous command over demons, and deploys the Ninefold Brilliance and Tenfold Severance, all serve to establish images according to ritual, embodying forms in full likeness—towering in the void, illuminating the Dharma-realm, piercing the dark and obscure, and transforming and delivering devas and humans.

Even to the cutting of clouds and unfurling of brocade, the spreading of brocade-like radiance and rosy dawn, the spurring of light to ride the void, and the congealing of spirit to merge with qi—thus do the hosts of heavens chant from afar, the myriad sages descend to the throne, the long night bursts into light, and the Nine Dark Realms cease their trials. The merit is vast indeed.

Therefore, the great Dharma of the Divine Treasure—its banners, streamers, staffs, and canopies—possesses its complete rituals. One must especially move the ancestral qi to merge with the divine radiance, exhaust the subtlest essence to achieve the boundless, adapt to conditions and manifest transformations, and respond to thoughts with spiritual resonance. It serves as the ford shared by life and death and the standard for revealing the hidden.

When it forms the void into the Brahmā-realm, when cloud-script fills the Great Void, when forms transform across the ten directions and spirits transcend the eight limits—universally aiding the sentient, broadly delivering the submerged—it is truly the ultimate aim of the Dao and Dharma, the ritual norm of purification and cultivation.

Vast and majestic above, how could it be neglected?
[Preserve and employ.]

When erecting banners and canopies, one must concentrate the spirit and visualize this direction as a vast sea palace, its silver waves suffusing the heavens, utterly free from obscurity or hindrance. Transform the erected banner into a crimson tally of rainbow streamers, a mushroom-canopied treasure-pavilion. Sun, moon, and starlight gleam resplendently upon it; auspicious winds stir and dance as its shadow ripples across golden lotuses. Brahmā-qi suffuses the expanse, its majesty towering like a celestial terrace.

Next, visualize one’s own primordial palace-qi merging within and without, mysteriously uniting with the treasures of heaven. Mounting the radiance of a hundred jewels, it illuminates the ten directions, universally aiding all existence. Heavenly perfected beings, the Great Sages of the Thirty-Two Heavens, and the exalted venerables of the upper realms all come to celebrate the assembly. This is the true efficacy of exalting virtue, establishing merit, summoning the perfected, and invoking the numinous.

**Four-Boundary Banners**
The right banner has four heads, made of yellow silk, each forty-nine feet in length. They are erected at the four gates of the commandery city during the pre-announced time, or set at a distance of one *li* or ten *li* as the standard. The Jade Emperor’s sacred title is inscribed in vermilion on the banner’s central panel. The seal-script follows the pattern of the *Announcement Talismans* in the *Tally and Memorial Gate*. **Alliance-Announcement Banner**

**Alliance-Announcement Banner (continued)**
The right banner is made from forty-nine feet of yellow silk, fashioning one banner head. At its top is inscribed: *"Your servant humbly and reverently memorializes."* The banner’s body bears the sacred titles: *The Most Supreme, Boundless, and Great Dao; the Utmost True and Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the True Writ Talismans; the Three Supreme Ones of the Great Dao; the Multitudes of Saints of the Ten Directions; the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm; and the Officials and Attendants of the Three Realms—all numinous powers.* It entreats their gracious radiance to witness and oversee the ritual proceedings.

On the banner’s two sleeves and base are inscribed the officiating Dharma Master’s title and the name of the petitioner, who, hailing from such-and-such a native place and acting as proxy, finds words inadequate to express his devotion. He has thus assembled a company of Daoist priests to erect this numinous banner in accordance with the *True Immortal Ranks of the Lower Prime Yellow Register Simplified Writs*, selecting an auspicious day to conduct the *Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast* for several days and nights. At the appointed time, the ritual will proceed in due order: reciting the profound liturgies, presenting memorials and petitions, issuing talismanic decrees, redeeming the sinful and the lost, releasing those in dark confinement, kindling lamps to perpetuate light, invoking radiance to dispel obscurity, universally bestowing *hú* offerings, summoning the departed souls, bathing and reclothing them, guiding them to attend the assembly of perfected beings and receive the Dharma, transmitting talismans and conferring precepts, refining and delivering them to rebirth. Upon completion, the merits will be declared in a memorial, *Dragon Tablets* will be cast into the waters, and a pure *jiao* offering will be reverently prepared to give thanks for the boundless grace. All accumulated virtues will be dedicated to the ascension of the departed, humbly beseeching the sagely blessings to universally succor both the living and the dead. The sincerity of the fast is thus openly proclaimed in this memorial.

**Altar-Erecting Banner**
The right banner is made from forty-nine feet of crimson silk and fashioned on the day the altar is established, displayed at its forefront. Thereby, the Three Realms are summoned in alliance, the Nine Dark Prisons are opened for deliverance, meritorious deeds are recorded, and names are inscribed in the *Yellow Register*. At night, a colored-globe lamp is suspended from the banner’s pole, its light penetrating the Ten Directions and illuminating the nether realms. Conducted in accordance with the liturgical canons, this accords with ancient ritual forms.

**Nine Heavens Precious Canopy**
The right canopy consists of nine banners in nine colors, each nine feet in length. At their centers are inscribed the nine *qi* talismans, while their reverse sides bear the titles of the Nine Heavenly Emperors. On their sleeves and bases are written the *Chapters on the Generation of Deities in the Nine Heavens*. From their eight corners hang eight banner heads, with a ninth suspended at the center. The canopy’s middle tier is adorned with nine nine-colored silk streamers, symbolizing the nine *qi*.

At the commencement of the fast, it is erected to the left of the altar.

**Nine Qi Talismans for the Nine Heavens Banner**
These talismans are used for the nine-cup lamp plaques and the refinement and deliverance rites of the *Nine Heavens Banner*.

The nine talismans are activated by forming the *Nine Heavens Hand Seal*, harmonizing the *qi* of the Nine Heavens, and invoking them with the *Chapter on the Generation of Deities in the Nine Heavens*. The *Nine Heavens Precious Canopy* embodies the transformative unfolding of the Three Heavens, the generation of deities by the nine *qi*, the veneration of the myriad sages, and the reverence of the hundred spirits. Thus, it enables the solemn observance of ancestral rites and the establishment of virtue and merit. At the ritual’s inception, it is hung in accordance with the liturgical canons. With unwavering sincerity, spiritual resonance arises naturally. This must not be omitted in grand fasts.

**Nine-Dragon Talisman for the Banner’s Central Panel**
**Blue-Green Profound Precious Canopy (Pattern)**
Also called the *Precious Banner*.

The banner on the right is crafted from azure silk. The main banner features a Nine-Dragon Talisman inscribed in white powder at its center, with the name of the Great One (*Taiyi*) written beneath the talisman. The hands and feet may also bear the intent of the fast’s sponsor, along with the talismanic proclamation. Above, the Precious Canopy has ten corners, each adorned with a small banner hanging from its tip, each four feet in length, all made of azure silk. The central banner measures twenty-four feet in length.

There is another method: fashioning it in the style of a silk canopy (*cai chuang*), which conveys the same meaning. The ten small banners bear the names of the Ten Directional Savior Heavenly Worthies:

**Eastern Jade Treasure August Heavenly Worthy**
**Southern Profound Truth Blessed Heavenly Worthy**
**Western Supreme Mystery Ultimate Heavenly Worthy**
**Northern Profound Supreme Jade Dawn Heavenly Worthy**
**Northeastern Deliverer of Immortals Supreme Sage Heavenly Worthy**
**Southeastern Life-Nurturing Deliverer of Destiny Heavenly Worthy**
**Southwestern Supreme Numinous Void Sovereign Heavenly Worthy**
**Northwestern Boundless Great Florescence Heavenly Worthy**
**Upper Jade Void Luminous Sovereign Heavenly Worthy**
**Lower True Sovereign Cavern Spirit Heavenly Worthy**

The Azure Profound Precious Canopy is suspended high in the air during the formal petition. Thus, the Most High, in boundless compassion, manifests the teachings across the ten directions, halting karmic retribution, responding to cries for salvation, delivering the departed souls, summoning the true and the numinous—without distinction between near and far—so all may partake in the wondrous fruit.

**Radiance-Returning Banner Pattern**
The banner on the right is made from forty-nine feet of crimson silk, inscribed with talismanic characters in cinnabar and realgar. It is erected before the altar at the commencement of the ritual. Thus, it reverses the radiance of the Two Luminaries amid profound darkness and guides the divine souls to the celestial heights. All who witness it are bathed in virtuous grace.

At the center of the banner, the following ten characters are inscribed:
One inscription of the Nine-Dragon Talisman.

**Great Compassion Precious Banner Pattern**
Made from forty feet of yellow silk.

**Great Compassion Decree of the Great One**
The Great One’s command of boundless mercy opens the path to deliver souls from the eternal night.

**Left Side of the Banner (Inscribed):**
Amidst the boundless Fengdu,
Layered peaks of Diamond Mountains stand.
The Limitless Light of Lingbao shines,
Piercing the flames and torments of the Scorching Pool.
The seven generations of ancestral souls,
Their forms follow the incense-cloud banner.
With the blue lotus of samādhi and prajñā,
They ascend to dwell in eternal peace.

**Right Side of the Banner (Inscribed):**
The golden radiance of merit and virtue,
Its brilliance dispels the darkest depths.
From the Flower Pool flows true fragrance,
As lotus canopies descend with floating clouds.
A thousand spirits, restored to primordial harmony,
Dwell forever in the Twelve Towers.
Swiftly proclaim the Lingbao decree,
That all may wander freely in the celestial paradise.

**Left Edge of the Banner (Inscribed):**
By the talismanic command of the Primordial Beginning,
The hour of ascension arrives.
In the Cold Pool of the Northern Capital,
The spirits are guarded and their forms protected.

**Right Edge of the Banner (Inscribed):**
Subduing demons and ensuring safe passage,
Souls are graded in the Southern Palace.
The dead undergo refinement,
Transformed into immortals through alchemical transmutation.

**Pattern for the Great Compassion Salvation Banner of the Great One**
At the center of the banner, inscribe the golden script of the Jade Characters of Brahma-conduct from the Golden Portal.

**Translation:**
In the Eastern Ultimate Palace,
The Greatly Compassionate and Benevolent One,
Responding to cries and hastening to salvation—
The Heavenly Worthy of Great Compassion and Salvation, the Azure Sovereign.

**Both Sides of the Banner (Inscribed):**
The Heavenly Worthies of Salvation in the Ten Directions.
(Their names, as listed previously, are inscribed five per verse.)

**Both Edges of the Banner (Inscribed):**
The Perfected of Great Compassion and Great Mercy, Savior of Suffering.
The Perfected of Great Compassion and Great Mercy, Deliverer of Souls.
The Perfected of Great Compassion, Great Mercy, and Great Wisdom.
The Perfected of Great Compassion, Great Mercy, and Wondrous Conduct.

This banner is made from forty-nine feet of azure silk.
It embodies the natural inner sound of the Three Heavens,
The Jade Characters of Brahma-conduct from the Golden Portal,
Responding to all directions to save the suffering,
Answering prayers with boundless mercy,
Transforming the Southern Palace,
And conveying spirits to the Northern Repository.
Wherever the banner’s form points,
All trapped in darkness are liberated,
For no merit surpasses this in the work of deliverance.

**Pattern for the Spirit-Conveying Precious Banner**
Made from forty-nine feet of crimson silk,
Inscribed with talismanic characters in realgar.

**Both Sides of the Banner (Talismanic Inscriptions):**
*(Translation follows)*

The talismanic decree traverses the boundless void,
The numinous banner flutters in the dawn wind.
Conveying spirits beyond the Northern Repository,
Ascending on winged sandals to the Southern Palace.
The banner, high-suspended in the heavens,
Commands the departed to erase their names from the Northern Repository,
And relocate their spirits to the Southern Palace.

**Pattern for the Yellow-Returning Precious Banner (also called the Numinous Banner of Command)**
**Talismanic Inscriptions (Both Sides):**
*(Translation follows)*

The Great Tenuity’s Yellow-Returning Banner,
The Numinous Banner of Wu-Ying’s Command.
It summons from the Long Night’s Repository,
And initiates deliverance for the reborn souls.

Made from forty-nine feet of yellow silk,
Inscribed with talismanic characters in cinnabar,
To be paired with the Spirit-Conveying Banner.
Whenever the rites are performed, both must be displayed—
One at the fore, the other at the rear—
For neither may stand alone without the other.

Some methods designate the *Numinous Banner of Wu-Ying’s Command* as the sole marker,
Yet the Jade Chapters explicitly pair the *Great Tenuity’s Yellow-Returning Banner*
With the *Numinous Banner of Wu-Ying’s Command*.
Little do they realize that *Wu-Ying* is the name of a deity,
While *Commanding the Numinous* signifies its function—
The banner is the numinous standard of the gods,
By which the deity Wu-Ying commands it to summon the souls of the Long Night.
To misname the banner *Commanding the Numinous* is to stray far from its original intent.
As the *Scripture of Salvation* states: *"Heavenly Ding march before, the Great Marshal bears the banner,"*
Yet one would not call it the *Great Marshal’s Banner*.
This principle must be thoroughly examined.

**Universal Summoning-Soul Banner Pattern**
At the apex of the banner, inscribe the human-form Summoning-Soul Talisman. The talisman is found in the *Divine Tiger Gate*. On the reverse of the banner, inscribe the front-and-back talismans. On the two hands, write the names of the Three Hun and Seven Po; on the two feet, record the year of birth and death.

Another method: Use white silk, seven feet and two inches in length, to make a double-layered banner, three feet and six inches long. On one side, inscribe the *Mysterious Darkness Taiyi Summoning-Soul Talisman* above and the name, year of birth and death of the deceased below. The names of the Three Hun and Seven Po are divided and written on the two hands. On the other side, inscribe the secret names of the Seven Perfected of Mysterious Darkness, and seal it with the *Divine Tiger Seal*. **Spirit Banner and Precious Canopy Section**

**Mandate Demon-Subduing Spirit Banner**
**Proclamation Text**
By the Jade Edict of the Primordial Beginning, the true talisman commands the demons.
Advancing before the path of fire, it opens and closes the void.
The Three Sovereigns reverently obey; its majesty subdues all demons.

**Talismanic Proclamation Script**
The banner is crafted from colored silk, seven feet in length, and erected at the center of the altar. When commanding demons, a youth is instructed to hold the banner, leading the ritual master in circumambulation. If paired with a precious canopy, it fulfills the guiding function of both banner and canopy.

**Refinement and Salvation Water Pool Banner**
**Inscribed on Reverse:**
Heavenly River Eastern Well Lord.

The banner is made of black silk, seven feet in length, with the talisman inscribed in white powder. It is placed beside the water basin.
