Vermilion Numinous Fire Mansion Lord.

The banner is made of crimson silk and placed beside the fire pool.

**Yellow-Robed Dao-Receiving Banner**
The talisman is inscribed on the reverse, followed by the text: *"So-and-so, upon receiving refinement, attains perfection."*

The banner is made of yellow silk, seven feet in length. During the refinement ritual, after the completion of the *Wen Lian Ji Ji* (文炼既济), the soul banner is burned and replaced with this banner, signifying the reception of the Dao in yellow robes.

**Fire Refinement Transmutation Immortal Banner Talisman**
The banner follows the previous specifications, crafted from red silk, seven feet in length. The talisman is inscribed at its center, with the lower portion bearing the text: *"So-and-so, through refinement, transforms their hun-soul into an immortal."*

On either side is written:
*"The dead soul receives refinement, transmuting into an immortal; the living body receives salvation, enduring through kalpas."*

**Six Jia Divine Envoys, holding banners to guide and lead.**

**Void-Penetrating Dark-Periphery Incantation Banner**
Each banner’s head is inscribed with two lines:
*"Divine resonance shakes the hollow void,
Nine Mysteries depart from dark descendants.
Sensations flow without obstruction,
Departure and stay dissolve like loosened sashes."*

This banner is made of yellow silk, seven feet in length.

**Four Salvation-from-Torment Banners**, following the previous specifications.

**Lingbao Yujian, Scroll Seven: The Memorial Header and Conjoined Talisman Gate**

The Great Rites of the *Lingbao Scripture of Salvation for All* commence with the establishment of a fast or ritual observance. At the outset of all proceedings, the *Marvelous Radiance of the Primordial Beginning’s Mandate*—a talisman of the Lingbao tradition—must be inscribed upon fine paper and affixed to the header of the memorial. This act first broadcasts a universal proclamation to the Three Realms, the boundless divine precincts, and the Nine Dark Realms, casting illumination into the eternal night. It mirrors the patterns of heaven and humanity while harmonizing with the hidden depths of the unseen. Without one who has awakened to the root of roots and disclosed the heaven of heavens, who could achieve such seamless fusion and penetrating clarity through the profound obscurities?

**Format of the Great Header Talisman**

**Lingbao Great Ritual Bureau**
Upon review of this day and month, on behalf of the ritual sponsor’s petition, we humbly beseech the deliverance of the soul of [Name], that they may ascend and attain liberation.
In reverent accordance with the Great Rites, we dispatch this memorial to the Celestial Court, petitioning the descent of the *Primordial Beginning’s Mandate of Salvation for All Perfected Ones*, to be transcribed and enacted as follows.

To the right, we present the *Royal Talisman*, proclaiming to the Three Realms and Ten Directions, the Earth Prisons and Underworld Bureaus, all agencies that constrain souls and govern spirits:
In strict adherence to the *Primordially Descended Edict*, release the bound souls as the law prescribes, liberating them from the shadowy realms to receive transformation and rebirth.
As decreed by the *Lingbao Ordinance of Boundless Salvation for All*, upon receipt of this talisman, it shall be executed without delay.

[Year] [Month] [Day] Proclaimed
[Ritual Rank] [Title] [Name], having received the mandate, pledges to carry it out.

**Format of the Lesser Header Talisman**
Two talismans, each inscribed on two tablets, rendered in yellow paper with vermilion ink, are to be conjoined and affixed to the memorial’s header.

**Primordial Beginning’s Mandate of Enlightenment**
This talisman proclaims to the Three Realms and Ten Directions, the Earth Prisons and Underworld Bureaus, all agencies that constrain souls and govern spirits:
In strict adherence to the *Primordially Descended Edict*, release the Dark Altar and the souls designated for deliverance, liberating them from the shadowy realms to receive transformation and rebirth.
As decreed by the *Lingbao Ordinance of Boundless Salvation for All*, upon receipt of this talisman, it shall be executed without delay.

[Year] [Month] [Day] Proclaimed
[Ritual Rank] [Title] [Name], having received the mandate, pledges to carry it out.

**Summoning, Employment, and Dispatching Gate**
Now, as for summoning, employment, and dispatching—unless one first illuminates the wondrous subtleties of the precelestial Great Dao and its numinous transformations, how could one partake in this?
For what reason?
From Non-Ultimate to Supreme Ultimate is the void transforming into spirit. The Supreme Ultimate’s movement as yang and stillness as yin is spirit transforming into qi. From this qi, pervading between Heaven and Earth, there arise humans and things. Humans, as the most numinous of things, within their nature and destiny possess all principles. Thus they parallel Heaven and Earth, assist in transformation and nurturance. When mind knows and intent arises, spirit moves and Heaven follows. Moreover, ghosts and spirits are the innate capacities of the two qi, the functioning of creation. Those who ride the sun and moon, embrace the cosmos, mount cloud-qi, and drive flying dragons—are they not the transformations of the numinous? Yet amid the ten thousand transformations, there must also be a governing spirit. Tracing its origin, this governing spirit is nowhere yet everywhere, neither form nor void. Its function is boundless, its substance traceless, yet it can command the ten thousand qi and unite the hundred spirits. Thus there are those who, without speaking, respond with goodness, and without being summoned, come of themselves. Therefore, the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure, in commanding the ten thousand offices, derive from this above. Yet one fears that as affairs daily entangle and human desires deepen, one may fail to reach the root and thus not penetrate the mysterious. Therefore, one must employ visualization, concentration, and thought, moving spirit to meet the Dao, aligning qi with qi, spirit with spirit, intermingling with the numinous. By refining sincerity and reverence, one may bridge the high and the low without gap, the distant and near without difference. Reaching through earnestness and communicating sincerity, one aids the living and delivers the dead. In a thousand changes and ten thousand transformations, responding to thought and penetrating all—this is none other than the wondrous flow of the primordial Great Dao. Summoning, employment, and dispatching are indeed the guiding principles of the Daoist arts—how could one not be cautious in this?

**Visualization and Application**
First enter the Hall of Refined Thought, settle the spirit and fix the intent. With eyes closed, visualize the Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Original Beginning descending in precious luminous true qi into the Mud-Pill Palace to sit in repose. The adept draws a qi from the lower field upward, merging it into one. With both hands in the Jade Clarity mudra, cross the fingers before the Lord of the Cinnabar Prime, ascending to pay homage to the Primordial Beginning. Secretly present the intent of the retreat, visualizing the ten thousand spirits of Heaven and Earth all coming to receive the command. Suddenly, one sees the Celestial Venerable’s merciful assent, decreeing that the Golden Lad and Jade Maiden bear forth a precious pearl, its radiance shining brilliantly in the ten directions. The adept, with a slight inhalation through the nose, swallows it into the lower palace, acting on Heaven’s behalf. Next, transform the four courier officials and clerks, stationing them before the altar to receive their duties and carry out the rites. Then, the Daoist assembly, arrayed in full dignity, proceeds to the retreat site.

**Ascending the Altar, Summoning the Generals, and Performing the Rites**
The master purifies the water, holding the water vessel in the right hand and forming the mudra with the left, intoning the incantation into the water:
Upper Terrace: one yellow, dispelling all inauspiciousness.
From *yin* to *si*: Middle Terrace, two whites, protecting the body and securing the dwelling.
From *chou* to *wu*: Lower Terrace, three greens, dispelling illness and expelling spirits.
From *zi* to *wei*: the Terrace Stars arrive, bestowing great majesty.
Draw with the nose the light of the Three Conjunctions and Six Stars into the water. Next, form the yin-yang Dipper mudras, guiding the light and qi into the water.
*Greedy, Massive, Emolument, Civil, Martial, Ruinous*... [lacuna] Next, form the Three Lights incantation mudras.

*Om, va va ra hui nao li svāhā.*
Draw the nine rays of sunlight inward to merge, then disperse into the water.

Draw the ten blossoms of moonlight inward to merge, then disperse into the water.

Ghosts red, ghosts yang, three ghosts, five ghosts, to thee I seize.
Draw the Celestial Stem qi inward with the nose to merge, then disperse into the water. Next, trace the *mao-wu zhong-you-zi* script, drawing the qi of the Five Directions inward with the nose to merge, then disperse into the water.

**The Gate of the Divine Tiger’s Pursuit and Seizure**

To ascend to heaven or descend to earth, to traverse the hidden and penetrate the netherworld, to summon yin and invoke yang, to pursue souls and seize spirits—how divine is this! Thus, the Great *Lingbao* Method possesses the *Divine Tiger’s Pursuit and Seizure*, which is the utmost numen of yin and yang, the pivot of creation and transformation. With the male on the left and the female on the right, the Three Divisions and Seven Perfected align with the Dipper’s Dao to unite with brightness, governed by the Great Culmen to exercise total control. Exhaling and inhaling the two *qi*, they blend the Three Luminaries, gather spirits by revolving the Purple Portal, and preserve the white while guarding the black. Refining the luminous in the *Dharma-Flower Capital*, they reverse the Yellow Mandate to command the numinous.

Within, the Dao’s *qi* and golden radiance; without, jade talismans and iron charters—all are the essence and function of the Divine Tiger. When its light congeals in the divine chamber and the luminous merges with the Mysterious Pass, only this singular truth remains, inherently devoid of all methods. Yet once invoked, it responds to thought and arises. Such is its divinity, such is its numinosity; such is its nature, such is its Dao. For it gathers the Five Agents in the empty valley, illuminates the primordial *qi* before heaven, harmonizes the hundred spirits, and revolves through the myriad transformations—how could its power be limited to merely restraining souls and controlling specters?

**On the Mysterious Model of the Five Dipper Altars**

When establishing the Divine Tiger Altar, one must arrange the five *fulu* talismans to guard the five directions. At the center stands the *Great Fuli Earth Diagram* of the Supreme Emperor, by which the spirits are summoned to arrive instantly. Without these texts, the divine perfected lack the light of resonance and cannot descend.

During the ritual, recite the *Three Chapters of the Demon Kings* and burn the *Red-Written Jade Characters* along with the *Two Chapters of the Eight Mighty Dragon Scripts* within. These spirits cannot be summoned without the *True Writ of the Primordial Qi of Heaven* and the *Jade Characters*. These chapters are the most forbidden texts of the *Mysterious Capital*. The Primordial Beginning summons all the divine numina of the celestial realms and the Three Realms with these very verses. When the myriad sages behold them, they all perceive the jade radiance and come forth.

In practicing the supreme Dao of *Lingbao*, the essence lies in refining *qi* and preserving the spirit, mirroring the true dharmic nature of the Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy, sharing in this wisdom-power to achieve resonance. Those who obscure this principle labor in vain and instead incur netherworldly retribution.

When summoning and commanding, knock the teeth twelve times, inhale the Primordial Qi of the Chaos Origin twelve times, and hold the breath briefly. Visualize the Gate of Heaven descending with purple clouds, entering to bathe your crown. Within the Central Palace, green, yellow, and white *qi* coil forth, intertwining with the purple clouds, imagined as the Primordial Beginning. Then visualize the Great One descending from the void. Inhale the *Qi of the Azure Mystery*, blending it with the Primordial Qi to transform into a hundredfold radiance of precious light, enveloping your form. From the Gate of Heaven, purple clouds and azure mists arrive. Where the *qi* reaches, divine officers, tiger warriors, jade lads, and talisman-bearing messengers appear, holding tablets and bearing talismans, arrayed to your left and right.

Then make the mudra, circulate the *qi*, knock the teeth, pace the *Ding* steps twelve times, and turn to face north. Cross the little fingers and middle fingers of both hands, pressing the two thumbs together into the central line. Recite:

**Oṃ. Kuśa-lu-kī-rūṃ-caṭa-luḥ. Half-seal.**

After the incantation, summon the generals as prescribed below.

The five *fulu* talismans and other texts are found in the *Gate of the True Writ and Jade Characters*.

**Practicing the Way of Commanding Whistles**
The Three Envoys emerge from the Northern Culmen of the Mysterious Model’s mansion, residing in the Great Abyss Palace at the head of the Three Yin’s primary office, governing the summoning of yin *qi*.

The Divine Tiger dwells at the head of the Triple Burner; the Seven Jade Maidens occupy the seven orifices. Yang radiance penetrates the gates; yin spirits seize souls.

The Divine Tiger Officer Lord resides beneath the left and right eyes—male on the left, female on the right—within the twin nostrils. Through breath, summon the Divine Tiger Envoys, all within the Flowery Pond. Distribute and disperse the *qi*, ascending and transforming to emerge, governing the hundred joints.

The Clear and Cold Soul-Seeking Generals reside in the two Long Ravine cavities of the kidneys. Rotate the numinous root seven times, call forth, and they emerge together, hastening to the Mysterious Altar and merging inner and outer.

Visualize the Divine Tiger Officer Lord arrayed in ranks before you, directing at will. Proceed to receive the command talisman, guide and lead the pursuit and seizure, and raise the Divine Tiger’s yin spirit manifestation. Step backward thirteen paces, both hands holding the Divine Tiger’s Soul-Seizing Seal, spreading the *qi* of the Flowery Canopy’s numinous root to restrain the souls of the ten directions.

Simply draw in the *qi* to guide and receive the departed soul—all souls follow the *qi* to the mourning banner. Then visualize the departed as they were in life, forming a single body to bridge yin and yang. With a single spray of water, all is accomplished.

In the Way of Commanding Whistles for the Divine Tiger, emit the *qi* of the heart and lungs, coalescing externally to send forth the image of swirling dark winds and mysterious mists. Call the Divine Tiger, and the heart’s resonance shapes the form—all spirit-generals arrive with whistling faces.

Next, proceed according to the method: whether issuing the Jade Writ, establishing the Divine Tiger Altar, or summoning and seizing the departed soul, perform all as described.

The Mystic Master declares: The Primordial Jade Slip is the covenant of the Jade Pure Divine Tiger, the esoteric decree of the Three Sovereigns for summoning spirits, possessing the Dao of reviving the dead and delivering the living. Whenever a petition is to be sent to the Nether Bureau, take white silk gauze three feet six inches in length—or seven feet—one foot two inches in height, lined with white paper. Inscribe the Jade Slip in vermilion on the front, the petition in black on the reverse, and write the deceased’s name in black, along with their life and death circumstances, beneath their corresponding star. If the names are numerous, record only the first name, adding "and others" below the slip. The rest shall be listed in a register and affixed to the front. The inner lining shall be made of yellow silk, fashioned into a square case, with a vermilion inscription on blue silk. Its surface shall be stamped with the Seal of the Inspector-General of Ghosts and Spirits. Along with the true forms of the Three Envoys, the passport, and the writ of passage, all shall be dispatched together and burned in a blazing flame. This slip is for grand fasts of universal deliverance; it must not be used recklessly.

When inscribing, burn incense and face east to memorialize the Great Dao, invoking the descent of the Lady of the Dark Abyss. With the left hand, form the Divine Tiger Mudra: the second and third fingers extended, the thumb pressing down, the little finger bent at two joints. Strike the teeth nine times, then recite the secret incantation for summoning the generals as before, visualizing the ritual’s execution. Draw the qi of the northwest into the brush and inscribe the slip.

**Visualizing the Divine Mudra**
The master sits in tranquil meditation, subtly drawing the light of the Northern Dipper from the Central Heaven, merging it with the primordial qi, ascending to the Mud Pill. The Perfected One of Unified Nature ascends to the court of the Originator, secretly memorializing the matter. Upon receiving the Jade Decree’s assent, the attending immortals are commanded to open the case and reveal the Primordial Jade Slip, which the adept shall receive and enact. Then, the vast primordial qi of the August Sovereign of the Nose descends with the slip, merging with the slip upon the altar to become one. Gazing intently, the adept perceives the inner taboo names of the Seven Perfected, their radiance piercing through, illuminating the depths of the Nine Yin. The Divine Tiger’s generals stand in solemn array, awaiting commands.

**Jade Slip for Yang Days**
**Jade Slip for Yin Days**

**Incantation for Each Star**
For the Yin and Yang Slips, combine the light-qi of the Northern Dipper with the ancestral qi, then anoint and recite over them:

*"Heavenly Unity’s Northern Blessing,
Supreme Unity’s Purple Radiance commands.
Divine Tiger’s halberd flies in motion,
Shaking the Dipper’s unified trail.
Wherever the Jade Slip arrives,
The ten directions’ essence-light is wholly drawn in.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!"*

**Celestial Jade Slip Decree for Yin and Yang Days**
*Translation of the Four Ding and One Character:*
The Primordial Jade Slip of the Most High, urgently summon the warrants of the Three Realms and Nine Provinces’ departed souls.
Swiftly, as the Emperor’s command decrees, execute without delay.
Divine Tiger officials and clerks, hasten to bear the talisman and report to the presiding authorities.

**Format of the Jade Slip**
Heavenly Unity’s Northern Blessing, Supreme Unity’s Purple Radiance, Northern Dipper’s Mysterious Darkness, Primordial Divine Tiger Jade Slip
For the Yellow Register Fast Altar, or the Nine Yin, or the Universal Salvation—submitted by Daoist official [Name] with reverent intent.

Having already followed the rites and memorialized the Celestial Court, filing petitions with all relevant offices,
Now, in accordance with the Most High’s original descent of the *Heavenly Unity’s Northern Blessing, Supreme Unity’s Purple Radiance, Primordial Summoning Soul Jade Slip*,
The Divine Tiger is commanded to execute the decree, and the officials and generals shall, by statute, pursue and seize the souls of the deceased [Names], bringing them to the altar to receive deliverance. This is hereby proclaimed.

Arrange the forms according to Yin and Yang days, and inscribe the talismans for each star below, then write the names and ages of the deceased beneath the talismans.
If the deceased are numerous, record their names on a register and attach it to the front.
After the Dipper’s form, inscribe the forty-one Celestial Seal characters, followed by the proclamation text.

**Right:** By order of the *Heavenly Unity’s Northern Blessing, Supreme Unity’s Purple Radiance, Northern Dipper’s Mysterious Darkness, Primordial Jade Slip Divine Tiger Talisman Command*,
Proclaimed to the Three Realms and Ten Directions, the Celestial Bureaus and Earthly Courts, mountains and seas, springs and valleys, the Gates of Darkness, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Six Caves and Ten Palaces, the Three Origins and Nine Offices, the One Hundred Twenty Bureaus, the Lands of Desolation, the Realms of Hidden Yin, all great hells, the Nine Provinces’ domains, city gods and earth spirits, village shrines and burial mounds, the Yellow Springs and Fields of Reeds—wherever souls are bound and constrained.
Pursue and seize the souls of the deceased [Names], immediately releasing them from their posts, and swiftly deliver them to the Mysterious Altar to pay homage to the August Emperor and receive their deliverance.

By special grace, the Divine Tiger receives its command—let all myriad spirits heed with reverence.
Proclaimed in the year of the Great Year-Star, the *__* month, the *__* day, the *__* hour.
The duly appointed officiant, Divine Tiger Enforcer of the Primordial Jade Slip, the minister [Surname] [Given Name], executes the charge.

*Inner Seal:*
Primordial Jade Slip of the Divine Tiger, bearing the talismanic command—inscribed upon the tally: the duly appointed minister [Surname] [Given Name] executes with reverence.
*Inscription on reverse of inner seal:*
Pursue and seize the souls of the deceased [Names] to attend the altar.

*Outer Envelope:*
Talismanic Command of the Primordial Divine Tiger Jade Slip—inscribed upon the tally: the duly appointed minister [Surname] [Given Name] seals with solemnity.

To the Lords of the Ten Directions, the Three Realms, and the Nine Dark Hells, and all myriad spirits—
*End of Scroll Nine of the Numinous Treasure Jade Canon*
*Scroll Ten of the Numinous Treasure Jade Canon: The Divine Tiger’s Pursuit and Seizure Gate*

After the Three Offerings, hold the jade slip in the left hand and grasp the sword in the right.
Invoke:
Divine Tiger, Pursuer of Souls, Heavenly Sage; Envoys of the Three Departments, Pursuers of Souls; Seven Perfected Jade Maidens and Immortal Hosts; Divine Offices’ Sevenfold Merit Officers; Pursuit and Seizure Officers of the Golden Watchtower and Mysterious Capital’s Inner Terrace; all bureau generals, clerks, and local earth spirits—
You must bear this Primordial Jade Slip of the Mysterious Dark Divine Tiger, traversing the Ten Directions and Three Realms, the boundless divine lands, grotto-heavens and immortal palaces, dark passes and hidden courts. Let all behold the radiant wisdom of the sun, and together depart the profound depths of the Yellow Springs to pursue and seize the souls of the departed herein commended. Come to the Mysterious Altar to receive deliverance, that karmic retribution be made manifest. Do not dare defy.
Hasten in accordance with the Statutes and Ordinances of the Supreme Northern Dipper’s Mysterious Dark Mandate.

*Summoning and Empowering the Divine Tiger’s Ruling Spell:*
Heavenly One of the Northern Foundation, Supreme One of the Purple Origin.
Northern Chief of the Mysterious Range, Divine Tiger of the Dark Mystery.
Great Sage within the Dipper, Jade Maidens who pursue souls.
Essences of the Ten Directions, respond to my call of spirits.
With each breath, enter my talisman.
Follow the qi forth, follow the qi in motion.
Transform into a thousand myriad forms—*yuan heng li zhen*.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Great Chief of the Central Dipper commands.

Press the left Divine Tiger Seal to the heart; form the right sword mudra at the waist. Visualize the body as the Azure Primordial Jade Form, and step the ruling step to dispatch.

*General Dispatch Ruling Formula:*
Golden radiance revolves through the Seven Circuits,
The Divine Tiger’s flying ruling opens the dark passes.
Turning to restore the celestial constant, treading the mysterious net,
Embracing simplicity, supporting the infant, stabilizing the virtuous orchid.
Vast and distant, supporting the full, reflecting the Emperor’s slope,
Ascending in splendor, riding the light, coiling through the patterns of destiny.
Harmonizing the Seven Spirits into one household,
Separation and union arise naturally with jade blossoms.
Mysterious Range and Northern Chief hold life and death,
The Supreme Dao’s breath roots and stems flourish.
I bear the Jade Slip’s Golden Tiger script—
Let all myriad spirits heed with reverence, none dare disobey.
Should any oppose this Great Dao,
You must demote or promote, that the Dao not fail.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Purple Tenuity Lady of the Northern Chief’s statutes command.

After the spell, form the Yin-Yang Dipper with both hands, sprinkle water to dispatch, and visualize the officials and generals bearing the jade slip straight into the Yellow Springs to seize the souls of the departed.

Next, burn the jade slip. With the right hand, fan the ashes to scatter them. With the left hand, press the index and middle fingers to the base of the thumb, then press the thumb to the middle crease, while the remaining three fingers open and close, curling backward as if pointing the Dipper’s handle forward.
Visualize the two stars of the Dipper’s mouth—through them, spirits are commanded and ghosts seized.

Invoke again:
By the command of the Heavenly One of the Northern Foundation,
The edict of the Supreme One of the Purple Origin.
The Divine Tiger’s halberd flies and moves,
The Big Dipper’s handle follows in unison.
Wherever the Jade Slip reaches,
The essences of the Ten Directions are all drawn in with a single breath.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes command.
*Seven times*

Invoke again:

The Three Treasures Lords of the Yellow and the Old,
Whose purple clouds ascend with Heaven’s qi.
They seize and restrain the souls of the Nine Depths,
The Great Mystery boundless in its reach.
All become natural beings—no fetters in hell’s confine.
Universally they open the gates of manifold wonders,
Awakening the Dao to birth wisdom and insight.
Swiftly, swiftly, by the statutes of the Most High.

With the tongue, stir the eyes to flash; through breath, summon the qi of the Ten Directions to return to the Origin. Blow upon the curtain within and upon the soul banner.

The Most High Chaos-Origin Jade Slip for Summoning Souls—Iron Warrant
(Translation of forty-two characters)

The Most High Chaos-Origin Jade Slip,
Swiftly pursues the warrant’s talismanic script.
It harmonizes and measures all suffering souls of the hidden and the faint,
Whether in the realm of the living or the courts of the dead.
All obey the Emperor’s command;
The Divine Tiger’s officials and generals seize them as decreed.
No slackening or disobedience is permitted.

Iron Warrant Formula:
Heavenly One of the Northern Foundation, Supreme One of the Purple Origin,
Northern Dipper, Dark and Profound, Chaos-Origin Divine Tiger’s Iron Warrant for Summoning Souls.

In the year of the Great Year-Star ______, in the ______ month, on the ______ day, respectfully prepared for [Name] as intended.

To the Celestial Court.

To the Divine Tiger’s officials and generals:
Pursuant to the statutes, seize the souls of the deceased [Name] et al., escort them to the altar to receive deliverance, that they may fulfill their destined ascent. Herewith the warrant is issued.

Inscribe the Dipper’s form and the talisman below.

Issued on the ______ day of the ______ month in the year of the Great Year-Star ______, at the ______ hour.

Executed by the ritual master, the humble servant [Name], holding the dharma rank of ______.

The Iron Warrant shall be inscribed on black silk seven feet in length and one foot two inches in height. The talismanic scripts and seals at the front shall be written in cinnabar and realgar. The header and proclamation text shall be written in white powder. For the talisman that may be exposed to dew, use blue ground with white script; for the square case, use white ground with red script. All else follows the conventions of the Jade Warrant.

The form of the Marquis Wei’s Envoy Zhang San.
The Gate of the Reed-Wrapped Dragon Sentinel.
The Talisman of the Three Primordials’ Capital Bureau.
The Eastern Dipper’s Summoning-Soul Merit: Completion in *Mao*.
The Southern Star’s Seizing-Spirit: Precision in *Li*.
The Western Numinous Record-Life: Revival in *Dui*.
The Northern Culmen’s Summoning-Soul: Solitary Transfer in *Kan*.
The Central Yellow’s Great Motion: Han Ming in the Center.
The Red Apricot and Black Ink: Generating the Ghost-Soul Summoning General.
The Polished True Socks: Manifesting *Qi* from *Kun* as the Summoning General.
The Numinous Treasure’s Central Treasury: The Five Dippers’ *Qi* Gathered at the Center.
Gather the souls, seize the spirits, swiftly manifest their forms beneath the descending banner.

The Supreme One Perfected’s Song of the Dipper, Dipper Formula:
"Swiftly summon the souls like lightning!"

Invocation:
Visualize the Jade Emperor as your dharma-body.

The mandate is entrusted to the Three Officials; the Three Officials receive the mandate and pass it to the Northern Dipper. The Northern Dipper transmits the command, dispatching the general [Name] to break open the earthly prisons and summon the deceased souls. Visualize this talisman as a golden talisman. This talisman is exclusively for pursuing and seizing the deceased souls.

First recite the Purification of Heaven and Earth Mantra, the Purification of Body and Speech Mantra, sprinkle purifying water, burn incense, sit upright, stabilize the *qi*, draw pure *qi* into the body through the nose, circulate and transform the primordial *qi* to exit through the *Niwan* Palace, ascending straight into the vastness of the heavens, where it transforms into the Five *Qi*, spreading the Thirty-Six *Qi* to merge with the ancestral *qi*. Visualize within the *qi* a golden palace of jade, its golden light shimmering, wherein the Three Pure Ones and the Jade Emperor appear with golden countenances and jade forms, distinct and clear. The Three Officials, the Northern Dipper, and the myriad deities of the Three Realms and Ten Directions assemble together. The ritual master, invoking his dharma rank, silently memorializes the purpose of the rite and requests the descent of the imperial mandate. Visualize within the golden light the compassionate countenance of assent; a beam of golden light from between the Jade Emperor’s brows pours into the ritual master’s brow, merging with the golden light to form a jade character. Then open the eyes, take up the brush, and inscribe the Jade Emperor’s taboo name. Visualize this character as shimmering golden light flowing down with the brush, completing the talismanic mandate as the generals enter the talisman. Envision the Three Officials and the Northern Dipper transmitting the mandate to the generals; the generals receive the mandate and proclaim it to the Five Peaks and Fengdu, whereupon all simultaneously obey the command to deliver the hidden souls.

Recite the Three Officials and Northern Fengdu, ascending to declare before the Highest Clarity, once through, and witness the earthly prisons shattered, transformed into a realm of purity, all assuming the forms of celestial youths and earthly maidens. Following the brush and riding the light, they are delivered from the earthly gates and come to the ritual altar.

Recite again:
"The hidden souls suffer greatly in sorrow;
Turn your thoughts to the Lord of Divine Empyrean.
The True Golden Talisman of Jade Clarity,
Blazing with fire, shatters the dense darkness.
For you, it dissolves the knots of grievance,
Delivers you from the depths of sinking,
Ascends to the Knife-and-Benefit Heaven,
Refines and transforms to rise in the Cinnabar Court.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"

Upon completing the incantation, memorialize in gratitude, visualize the Emperor’s carriage returning, and withdraw the golden light to restore the spirit.

Talisman Formula (no envelope required):
The Capital Bureau of the Three Primordials’ Talisman Envoys Office.
On the ______ day of the current month, submitted on behalf of [Name] to beseech the deliverance of the soul of [Name].

Having already memorialized the Celestial Court, the decree is hereby issued.

The Jade Emperor’s Golden Talisman delivers and saves the departed souls—this decree must be proclaimed below.

**Talisman**

Let them all assemble at the ritual altar to partake in the offerings and hear the Dharma.

Upon the talisman’s arrival, the decree is enforced. The Three Officials and the Northern Feng shall inspect the ghostly camps—none may conceal or obstruct. Submit this at the Golden Horse Post.

Proclaim universally, let all spirits heed:
The Five Emperors of the Three Realms shall report to the Supreme Clarity.

Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Yuan Shi Emperor’s *Statutes for Delivering Humanity*!

**Decree issued in the year ______, month ______, day ______, at the hour ______.**
Submitted by the ritual master [Name], in full ordination rank.

**Dispatching the Decree**
The High Priest holds the water vessel and recites the *Three Officials and Northern Feng Incantation* once. The officiant visualizes the Jade Emperor, the Three Officials, the Northern Dipper, the Five Marchmounts, and Fengdu, all riding clouds and qi, receiving the mandate and awaiting commands.

Recite it again—ten thousand spirits bear the talisman away.
Recite it once more—visualize the hells of Fengdu collapsing, transformed into a realm of cool purity. All wandering souls assume the forms of celestial men and women, riding golden light to emerge from the earthly gates and proceed to the ritual altar.

Then recite the *Incantation for the Sorrowful Wandering Souls* once.

**Divine Tiger Yin-Yang Two-Altar Discussion**
The Master says: For grand rituals, prepare in advance the *Hun Yuan Jade Document* and cut nine feet of yellow silk into three sections. On the left, paint the true forms of the Three Envoys with their proper vestments and colors. To the left of their images, inscribe in cinnabar the talismans of the Three Envoys, the *Divine Tiger Pass Document*, the *Petition of the Departed Soul*, ensuring all is complete.

At the *Gen* gate, establish a *Hall of Gathered Souls*, facing south. Set up a table for the Divine Tiger officials and generals, with offerings of tea, wine, fruit, and food. First, perform the ritual transformation, pace the stars, and summon the generals. Issue the *Jade Document Pass* and other documents.

Next, on purified earth within the hall, construct the altar layout: to the left, the *Yang Radiance Passage Altar*; to the right, the *Yin Spirit Seizing Altar*. Level the ground into a square, each side three feet and six inches. The ritual master proceeds according to the altar diagram, drawing it upon the earth.

Place the male and female seals at the altar’s center. Set up the tablets of the Left and Right Prison Warden Envoys in one chamber. Enclose the perimeter with white silk curtains, ensuring no gaps. On the table, light a bright lamp and place the *Spirit-Seizing Youth Talisman* and the *Divine Tiger Summons Talisman*. Fill two vessels with water, soaking one *Divine Tiger Pursuit Talisman* each, and place them beneath the altar’s central tablet.

One hour before the manifestation, prepare three *Manifestation Talismans* along with the *Underworld Wealth Pass* in several portions. Burn one, submerge another in water, and let the ritual master consume the last. Holding the talisman water in the left hand and wielding the sword in the right, recite the *Tian Yi Northern Zu Incantation*. Inhale the qi of the Ghost Gate nine times into the water, then spray it upon the altar, reserving the remainder on the table.

Seal the chamber with curtains, bar the door, and prohibit entry. Open the curtains only when the time comes to summon the souls. Place banners on the left and right of the two altars. Burn the *Manifestation*, *Release of the Wandering*, *Communication*, and *Clairvoyance Talismans* in the water and sprinkle it. Spray the youth medium’s body, instructing them to point out the spirits’ forms.

After a while, faint traces may appear. If the deceased was a filial child, loyal minister, righteous man, or chaste woman—whose devotion was sincere—their spirit may manifest as in life, allowing conversation. If they wail loudly and their soul flees in alarm, they have departed far. Only with utmost sincerity and kindness will communion be achieved. Beware of anger, impure motives, or reckless gazing—divine retribution is no trifling matter.

**Eight-Gated Altar Design**
The master says: To summon the soul and manifest its form, erect an Eight-Gated Summoning Altar at the center of the Divine Tiger Hall, each gate eight *chi* and one *ren* apart. The earth opens into eight gates, encircled by red silk twisted leftward, nine *chi* in length—or fifteen *chi* if the space allows. Use sixteen iron stakes, each six *chi* long. Place white placards beneath them, inscribing the names of the eight gates and distributing the eight gate talismans. Fill a pure basin with the elixir decoction, steep the *Iron Trace, Terrace Light, Treasure Seal* within, and set it at the center. By ancient method, fashion a straw effigy, dress it before the Gate of Life according to its attire, place the *Great Brahma Hidden Incantation* within its abdomen, and crown it with the *Great Heavenly Voucher of Ascension*. Hang it from a scale hook, allowing the straw figure to hover three to five *cun* above the ground.

In advance, prepare a seven-*chi* two-*cun* white silk banner for summoning the soul and seizing the *po*, each three *chi* six *cun* in length. One for the male, one for the female. Affix them to an eight-*chi* four-*cun* bamboo pole, tying the banners at the top. Place the male banner to the left, the female banner to the right, with the soul-summoning banner at the center. Inscribe *Iron Trace Terrace* on the male banner and *Treasure Light Seal* on the female banner. On the appointed day, perform the summoning ritual, having a young boy and virgin girl each hold a banner, standing to the left and right of the ritual master. Proceed with the summoning of the generals and the rites, offering tea and wine as prescribed. The Daoist assembly chants the *Cavern Chapters*, burns the summoning memorials, and ignites paper money and spirit horses before invoking the deceased.

The master first grasps the banner with the right hand, forms the *Summoning All Souls* mudra with the left, taps the teeth nine times, emits three whistles to the left, and three calls to the right. Then he chants the *Summoning Soul Incantation* and the *Yin-Yang Dipper Chapters*. As he visualizes and performs the rites, he covers the straw effigy with the banner, and the Yin soul comes to attach itself. When the banner grows heavy and the bamboo pole bends, and the straw figure’s scale weight touches the ground, sprinkle purifying water to welcome the soul, escort it to the tent for healing, bathe it, and change its garments. After it pays homage to the Perfected and receives offerings, due to the prolonged refinement and transcendence, fear that the deceased may dread the living’s Yang *qi* and scatter its Yin *po*. Thus, use the banner to guide it back to the Soul-Gathering Hall, entering through the Gate of Death before sealing it.

Next, take the water from the altar and sprinkle it in the ten directions of the altar. Those enshrouded regain their form and complete their *po*, enabling them to manifest awareness, cast shadows, and reveal their shape. Guide the soul to receive refinement, periodically opening the Gate of Life to lead it out and in for purification.

**Iron Trace, Terrace Light, Treasure Seal Talisman**
Inscribe this talisman on a three-*chi* azure paper placard, using gold powder or realgar ink. Place it at the center of the Eight-Gated Altar. Also inscribe it on a three-*cun* yellow silk with cinnabar. Steep *fuling*, *fushen*, *asparagus root*, *ginseng*, and *rehmannia* in a decoction, and set it within the altar. After the summoning, sprinkle the altar’s ten directions with a willow branch. Those enshrouded will revive their spirit, complete their *po*, and manifest their form and shadow.

**Right Banner Talisman: Treasure Light Seal**

Use this mudra to summon thunder, command lightning, call dragons, restrain the fury of thunderclaps, subdue the ferocity of tigers and leopards, and dispatch spirits to seize ghosts.

**Supreme Unity Seizing Soul Combined Talisman (Banner Reverse)**

**Sealing the Form and Closing the Debt Gate**
Now, that which is refined *qi* becomes matter,
And the wandering soul undergoes transformation—
This is what is meant by emerging from and entering into the mechanism.
All that possesses form and substance,
Upon birth, must perish.
Yet that which is formless and insubstantial,
Neither arises nor ceases.
Moreover, when a person’s spirit and *qi* disperse,
The bodily husk remains.
Once the coffin is sealed and affairs concluded,
Whether through failure to select an auspicious site,
Or to divine a propitious hour,
Delay ensues, and the coffin lingers unburied.
Yet the heart of the filial and benevolent cannot bear this,
And so they must await the cultivation of good karma,
To express reverence for virtue, requite merit,
And fulfill the duty of honoring the distant past.
Only then may the funeral rites proceed—
Such is often the case.
Yet during the period of cultivation and reverence,
How can the impurity of the corpse be avoided?
Thus, the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure
Hold the principle of sealing the form and closing the debt gate,
A method truly aligned with the Dao of corpse-liberated immortals.
Therefore, through the art of concealing one’s radiance and concealing one’s form,
The untransformed corpse is concealed.
Through the wondrous, pure, and luminous light,
The already-dispersed wandering soul is delivered.
Thus may it transcend to the realm of soundless and scentless spirit,
And realize the Dao in the heaven of neither arising nor ceasing.
Then good fruits and virtuous causes
May be cultivated with ease.
Yet who, save those whose hearts are empty and illusory,
Whose principles are awakened and spirits forgotten,
Could achieve this?

**Method for Concealing the Coffin**
The Master says: In households with unburied coffins,
Should they wish to cultivate merit and fruition,
Not only will the true imperial spirits fail to attend,
But both the living and the dead may incur blame—
The consequences are grave.
If urgent deliverance is required,
Rely solely on talismanic methods to conceal the coffin.
The Master must concentrate the spirit and calm the mind,
First burning incense in a purified chamber,
And memorializing the Jade Emperor,
The Supreme Compassionate One of Taiyi,
The Three Heavens and Eight Manifestations,
And all the great perfected ones who save the suffering and deliver the lost.
Secretly reveal the sincerity of the heart,
And request the descent of the true, numinous *qi*,
To infuse the cinnabar brush-tip.
Then, in accordance with the method, write the talisman
And await the moment of action.
When establishing the altar,
Within the ritual space,
Memorialize the true imperial spirits,
Summon the celestial generals and officials of the appropriate department,
And the Lords of the Year, the Jiazi, and all palace lords,
To descend together to the altar site,
Conceal the coffin, and purify its impurities.
Only when the interior and exterior are cleansed,
And the altar space is solemn and pure,
May the rites of cultivation, prayer, and deliverance proceed.
Those who uphold the Dharma must not be careless.

**The Gate of Lamp Division and Ritual Implement Regulation**

The *Scripture* states: "The revelation of the Three Luminaries is called the Root of Heaven." Thus, the primordial, original, and initial Three Qi are the root and origin of the myriad transformations, the great foundation of heaven and humanity. From this, the vast and formless Great Brahmā unfolds; the Three Qi radiate light, giving birth to heaven and earth, sun and moon, stars and constellations. Therefore, in the grand rites of the Numinous Treasure, at the inception of altar establishment, one models the principle of the primordial chaos’s first division. Thus, lamps are divided and torches arrayed to unfold the light of the Three Qi and generate the Three Luminaries. Bells are rung and jade chimes struck to harmonize yin and yang, giving rise to the myriad transformations—all in accord with the natural workings of heaven.

One must understand that formless qi is the Ancestral Qi, and colorless light is the Light of Wisdom. From one comes three, from three extends nine; through the ninefold nine transformations, the myriad lights are born. They illumine the ten thousand heavens, brighten the nine earths, and penetrate within and without, inheriting their brilliance. Only then does one respond to the soundless sound within the gold and jade, and enact the unchanging transformation beyond yin and yang. Taking the Dao as essence, all sentient beings and creeping creatures shall forever have a refuge. Such is the wondrous subtlety of the Dao’s profound and mysterious workings—how could there be any separation between the hidden and the manifest, the lofty and the deep?

**Method for Dividing Lamps and Their Application**

First, inscribe the Talisman of Wisdom Light, roll it, and seal it into a wax torch. At noon, gather the solar essence with a burning mirror. Recite the *Incantation of Solar Radiance*:

*"O radiant light of the Great Sun,
Divine illumination pervades the Three Clarities.
Qi scatters within the dark void,
Spiritual mist arises in the Purple Court.
Governing and riding the winds and clouds,
Drifting and soaring beyond all form.
Hasten! As the statutes command."*

This method gathers the true qi of the sun to kindle a lamp before the Primordial Celestial Worthy. When ascending the altar, the master visualizes this lamp’s golden light, like molten gold in hue, merging with the adept’s own radiance to form a solar wheel, translucent within and without. Next, circulate a single qi from the Muddy Pellet, ascending to join the precious light of the Primordial One, merging as one body. Then, with the talismanic torch, divide the central lamp: from one comes two, from two comes three, and from three, the myriad lights are transformed, universally illuminating the eight directions. The celestial perfected, the upper sages, and the hosts of the Three Realms all converge with the precious light, ascending together to the altar steps. The courts of yang and the dark realms are all transformed into celestial paradises.

When the lamp division is complete, place the remaining torches into the main censer. Silently recite the incantation:

*"The Most High descends with Wisdom Light,
Luminous lamps connect the spirit.
All heavens shine resplendently,
The earthly prisons are all illumined.
The adept’s body, too, is radiant,
The five viscera flourish with splendor.
The fiery brilliance illumines the Great Origin,
Distant visions reach the Jade Capital.
Hasten! As the Lord of the Three Heavens’ statutes command."*

**Incantation for Distributing Wisdom Light**

*"Compassionate talismanic script,
Jade tablets wafting mist.
Lamp blossoms scatter radiance,
Illuminating all heavens.
Brightening the Three Realms,
Piercing the depths of the Yellow Springs.
The dark and hidden awaken,
Blessings extend without bound.
Today’s great celebration
Allows all to ascend and advance.
The Dao generates the One Qi,
Myriad transformations attain perfection.
The majestic decree of the Primordial One

**On the Casting of Bells and Chimes**

The method states: Cast bells from metal, and when struck, their sound first summons the yang spirits. Carve chimes from jade, and when sounded, their resonance first summons the yin spirits. These are the finest instruments for harmonizing yin and yang.

The master should:
- Strike the teeth on the left to sound the golden bell twenty-five times, summoning the martial hosts.
- Strike the teeth on the right to sound the jade chime thirty times, gathering the perfected spirits.
- Strike the teeth at the center to beat the ritual drum twenty-four times, making it heard by the Celestial Emperor.

Internally, these follow the numbers of heaven and earth’s yin and yang; externally, they unfold the nine harmonies and ten unions of sound. First, invoke the barrier-warding and altar-guarding generals, burn the talismans, proclaim the documents, strike the jade, and sound the metal—only then may the spirits be summoned to descend.

**Great General Warding Against Evil** – Talisman of Paper-Flying Mao Script.
**Great General Guarding the Altar** – Talisman of Yang Fortune You Script.

Both deities wear the Heavenly Cadet’s crown, pale red robes, and green immortal garments, appearing in the forms of tiger and dragon.

**Lord of the Nine Harmonies of Yang Spirits**, Lu Hui, styled Yanling, stands eight feet tall. He wears a three-tiered crown and a reddish-brown robe, wields a sword in his left hand, and can purify heaven and earth of filth, driving away the spirits of the hundred trees. He emerges from the left eye and stands to the left.

**Lord of the Ten Unions of Yin Spirits**, Lu Tong, styled Yongfu, stands eight feet tall. He wears a three-tiered crown and a white floral robe, wields a sword in his right hand, and can sever the underworld’s bonds, examining and punishing the grievances of the mortal realm. He emerges from the right eye and stands to the right.

Next, circulate the ears, nose, and tongue, blending auspicious winds and auspicious qi to connect with the celestial scene, like moonlight spreading across the ten directions.

**The Jade Mirror of Numinous Treasure, Scroll Eleven—Concluded**
**The Jade Mirror of Numinous Treasure, Scroll Twelve**
**The Rite of Commanding Water and Warding the Altar**

The Dao’s essence is utmost emptiness; without emptiness, it cannot respond to phenomena. Human nature is fundamentally good; without goodness, the Dao cannot be illuminated. The nature of water is likewise—only through goodness can it benefit all things. The Great Rites of Numinous Treasure include the *Rite of Commanding Water and Warding the Altar*, which draws the upright *qi* of the Three Luminaries, circulates the true essence of the Nine Phoenixes, summons and deploys the myriad spirits, exhales and inhales the Two *Qi*, treads the *Dipper’s* path, and establishes the altar’s sacred boundary. In small measure, it purifies and solemnizes the four quarters; in great measure, it clarifies and brightens heaven and earth. By adorning the inner and outer rites, it aligns the descent of spirits above and below. Thus, purity in fasting is foremost, and sincerity in clarity is fundamental. For the perverse can only encroach upon the upright—without upright *qi*, one cannot dispel what is false. Filth can only corrupt the true—without true *qi*, one cannot cleanse what is defiled. Thus, the *qi* of upright truth engenders the marvel of transformation and circulation.

Now, with inner and outer integrity, nature and Dao both luminous, all realms purified, and not a speck of dust adhering—is this not the efficacy of gathering emptiness and congealing spirit?

**Chapter on Visualization for Commanding the Altar**

For the *Rite of Commanding the Altar*, first place the *Water Sword* at the *Earth Gate*. Select a Daoist of dignified bearing to prepare the altar tablet and proceed to the *Earth Gate* where the *Sword* and water are stationed. The *qi* of heaven and earth is what first gives birth; all things emerge and enter through it. Thus, the southeast is the extreme of yang and the birth of yin—hence, the southeast is the *Earth Gate*. The northwest is the extreme of yin and the birth of yang—hence, the northwest is the *Heavenly Gate*. Therefore, in the practice of *Morning Audience with the Perfected*, one always departs from yin to approach yang.

First, close the eyes and visualize the Three Masters of the Scriptural Transmission facing west. Next, visualize the *Great General of Concealing the Body*, surnamed Tang, named Hong, styled Wenming, wearing a crimson yang-red headband and a *Tongtian* crown, clad in vermilion robes, girded with a jade sword bearing a dragon’s head, and holding a golden talisman in his left hand. Then visualize the *Great General of Hidden Shadow*, surnamed Ge, named Yong, styled Wendu, wearing a crimson yang-blue headband and a *Tongtian* crown, clad in vermilion robes, and wielding a jade halberd. Next, visualize the *Great General of Concealed Form*, surnamed Zhou, named Wu, styled Wengang, wearing a crimson yang-red headband and a *Tongtian* crown, clad in vermilion robes, and holding a *Yang Jade* staff.

Next, visualize the Perfected Officials in crimson robes riding the Nine Phoenixes. Then, step the *Dipper of Breaking Filth*, visualizing the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper covering one’s head, the Dipper’s handle pointing forward without obstructing the ears or eyes. Next, assume the ritual position, announce the purpose of the fast, and conclude with the Three Bows. Retrieve the altar tablet, let the hands hang naturally, and clench the fists to summon the Four Numinous Beasts.

The Four Numinous Beasts are the Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, and Dark Warrior. With the left hand, form the twelve mudras, visualizing the *qi* of the liver and heart transforming into their forms, emerging to stand at the left front. Then, with the right hand, form the *You* and *Zi* mudras, visualizing the *qi* of the lungs and kidneys transforming into their forms, emerging to stand at the right rear. Next, clasp the hands over the heart, stand in the *Ding*-character stance, and recite the *Summons of the Three Officials*. Then, step the *Three Officials’* *Ding* *Dipper* three times toward the *Sword* and water, and afterward, form the five-direction mudras to summon the Five Dragons.

Upon completion, take up the *Sword* and water, face the direction, and hold the incantation. Next, approach the altar and sprinkle the purificatory water. Upon finishing, proceed through the *Human Gate*, step the *Yu* step and *Dipper*, advance to the *Ghost Gate*, strike with the sword, and retreat. Then, bow three times, and press the middle finger of the middle hand. Visualize all the spirits transforming and the true *qi* returning to one’s body.

Divine lamps brighten the long night, the Net of Separation exhales luminous brilliance.
Revolving peaks gird the lofty clouds, suspended essences shade the Eight Extremities.
The Three Pristine Ones open the high void, orchid gates unfold in layers.
Golden ramparts reflect Jade Clarity, numinous elegance adorns heaven’s precincts.
Winds arise in the Eight Conclaves’ palaces, fierce beasts gallop through the clouds.
In the Three Caverns’ courts, the perfected intermingle in disarray.
Above dwell the thousand luminous spirits, their dark virtue towering and majestic.
The Great One of the Supreme Dao gathers their schemes, wielding the banner of spirit command.
The Orthodox Unity treads the path of flourishing numen, summoning the myriad spirits to return.
The Duke’s son guards the silent axis, the Cavernous Yang shields the mysterious mechanism.
At dawn’s first light, the Dao harmonizes in tranquility, the Dragon Chariot lingers in pause.
The Seven Radiant Ones align with the Spirit Kings, their whirlwind wheels traverse the ten thousand treetops.
They lift their heads above the Mystic Ford, their flying steps ascend the peaks’ ladders.
Broidered patterns enter the Spirit Mounds, resplendent plumes flutter on feathered robes.
Dark mists intermingle in clouded gatherings, flying radiance bears the transmission of spirit.
Clear peaks bear no trace of green, woven patterns arise in the void’s extremity.
Golden splendor girds the numinous chariot, winged immortals seek the heights.
Ten thousand reins scatter through the void, lush vapors veil the upper windows.
Within, the Lord of Merged Radiance is born, the Nine Emperors flourish as the Supreme Sovereign.
Bright wheels reflect the Yellow Tranquility, feathered pearls gleam in the Mysterious Yang.
The Celestial Crystal’s primordial essence, the Central Five is called the Nurturing Light.
The Luminous Chapter of Primordial Generation is knit, the Nine Perfected unite in pairs.
Wondrous radiance unfolds the hidden, responsive resonance marks the Spirit’s lineage.
The Mud Pill Palace leads the Cavernous Origin, the Vermilion Palace governs the revolving pearl.
The Gate of Life commands the Primordial Yang’s domain, the Three Spirits escort the Purple Youth.
They restrain and summon the upper realms to return, flanking the gates to attend the Bright Window.
Lush mists face the Rising Brilliance, the Round Flower illumines the Three Peaks.
The Square Fullness draws forth and receives life, reversing age to restore infant innocence.
Whirlwinds gleam across the Nine Heavens, green axles coil around the Cinnabar Chamber.
Whispering winds weave beyond the mists, bending low to descend in the Flowering Hall.
Roaming and feasting through ten thousand kalpas, they return to assemble with the Spirit Sovereign of the Empyrean.
The Dao of immortals delights in the child’s life, the ghostly path delights in the child’s doom.
Yet one hears only of the noble path of life, never of the ghostly path’s exaltation.
A distant song harmonizes with heaven’s *qi*, Jia’s son chants the Primordial Upright Chapter.
Divine wisdom commands the Crimson Host, the Five Emperors’ talismans chill the northern wilds.
Wielding banners, they subdue the myriad demons; jade writs inspect the Northern Feng.
The Dao of spontaneous dissolution—demons’ demise is not your merit.
Floating radiance drums the long fan, merging voids to celebrate the Empyrean’s peak.
Gazing down, they turn and bid farewell to the flying ones, their heavenly tribulations forever unending.
Within the wondrous, true radiance is born, the returning chariot lingers in delay.
Intent harmonizes in dark resonance, lifting them to the highest cliffs.
Soaring beyond the appointed wondrous assembly, the Cavernous Vision stirs sorrowful longing.
With a whistle, a shout, a sigh—suddenly they traverse the Nine Enclosures.
Gathering *qi*, they return to the primal exchange, merging radiance in the dark and mysterious.
Then the Seven Stars halt their brilliance, the layered gates of the cavern swing open,
Stone Yang sparks lightning, the Five Stars rush in motion.
Grasping the tally, they command the spirits—all *qi* is pursued.
Iron bears form a net, fierce tigers transform in might,
The Six Armies behead demons, bronze-headed warriors seize the lawless,
The Heaven-Swallower devours poison, crystal dissolves and crushes.
Myriad spirits are annihilated, the Six Heavens collapse,
The Three Paths are rectified—what *qi* does not return?
Mountains and rivers topple, sun and moon veil their light,
Spirit beasts bow their necks, the Golden-Winged One falls in flight.
The Five Emperors gird their sashes in the divine precincts, the myriad spirits receive their seals in the Grand Tenuity.
The Supreme Ones float their canopies above the Cinnabar Cliffs, the Eight Radiant Ones spur their chariots at the Empyrean’s gates.
Beholding the Cavernous Origin’s wondrous transformation, I rejoice in the Dao’s open embrace.

These two chapters, when recited at the time of the prohibitive altar, should be intoned while circumambulating the altar thrice. Upon completion, proceed to establish the boundary and conduct the rites.

For each direction’s boundary, employ the Five Directions’ Jade Writs for subduing evil.
When establishing the altar, secure the gates with stabilizing talismans.

*Precious Canon of the Numinous Treasure, Scroll Twelve* concludes.
*Precious Canon of the Numinous Treasure, Scroll Thirteen* begins.

**Gate of the Night-Opening Morning Offering**
The Dao states: The transformations of heaven and earth, the Dao of the sages—these lie in non-action and spontaneity alone.
For non-action and spontaneity mean neither striving nor deliberation.
Within this neither-striving-nor-deliberation, profound as the ancestor of the myriad things, lies the great root of heaven and humanity.
Yet those who can embody sincerity and reverence, harmonize heaven and humanity, and unify them in the Dao—thus the teachings prescribe the Dao of morning cultivation.
Morning cultivation occurs thrice daily, establishing the altar to perform the Dao, offering rites of gratitude to the Primordial.
This embodies the principle of thrice-daily communion, daily proclaiming the Three Virtues.
Extending this to three days and nine mornings also follows the number of the Nine Yang.
Thus, the sincerity of nine prostrations and nine offerings is fulfilled.
Its purport declares: The divine transformation of the Precious Pearl, the Great One containing the true,
The Five *Qi* paying homage to the Primordial, the Three Flowers gathering at the crown—this is called the inner vision.

The inscribing of flying petitions and talismans, the performance of ritual protocols to expound the Dao, the transcription of prayers and presentation of memorials, the rites of repentance and gratitude—these are called the outer visions.

Thus, all outer visions are fundamentally rooted in the wonders of the inner vision. Without profound clarity regarding the Dao of inner and outer, who could fully grasp their essence and function?

Now, considering the essence of the Dao: it is so small that nothing lies within it, yet the myriad things share a single root. Extending to the function of the Dao: it is so vast that nothing lies beyond it, yet from this single root arise the myriad things.

Thus, one must further understand that which constitutes its essence: it abides in being yet leaves no trace. That which constitutes its function: it originates in non-being yet enables action.

From this perspective, one may attain vastness while exhausting subtlety, uniting inner and outer while embracing both essence and function. In all that is spoken, there is nothing that is not the wonder of non-action and spontaneity.

Therefore, in the moments of morning cultivation and reverent audience, how could one be negligent or allow interruption?

**Lingbao Natural Contemplation of Divine Rites and Formulas**

The *Suqi* (Evening Prelude) takes place on the day before the formal retreat. At an auspicious hour, the altar is established, mats are arranged, offices are filled, precepts are recited, the assembly is exhorted, and the Three Realms are notified—this is the evening of the announcement, not the day of the formal retreat when the Dao is practiced.

The master says: On the following morning, the Dao is practiced, and the announcement is made again. On the appointed day, the practice begins at the first dawn audience.

Thus, the *Suqi* notification and memorial are not part of the formal retreat’s Dao practice.

Those observing the retreat must, on the preceding day, bathe and reside in the retreat quarters. At the auspicious hour of the appointed day, the assembly is led in full dignity to escort the High Priest and Master before the master’s seat. The retreat officer is invited to burn incense and present the retreat petition to the High Priest.

Then, the High Priest, standing before the master, announces the intent of the retreat.

The retreat’s discipline is most solemn: all the celestial worthies and sagely beings descend to oversee it. Every matter must conform to the proper standards. Even the recitations, chants, and hymns of the *Dujang* must be paced appropriately—neither rushed nor delayed.

When the High Priest makes announcements, he stands facing east, holding the tablet, bowing slightly, modulating his voice, and regulating his *qi*. His words should be direct, plain, and unadorned, without excessive embellishment.

For all prayers and supplications, repentance must precede the request.

Whenever the High Priest ascends the altar to practice the Dao, he washes his hands and rinses his mouth with fragrant water—this is called *Danghui* (Dispelling Impurities). Afterward, he does the same—this is called *Bizhenqi* (Sealing the True *Qi*).

At the *Pingdan* hour of *Yin* (3–5 a.m.), he contemplates the green *qi* emerging from the liver like rising clouds, encircling the altar hall. The Azure Dragon and lion guard the front and rear, while jade lads and maidens, celestial and terrestrial immortals, the sun, moon, and stars, the Five Emperors’ troops, the overseers of the retreat, and the officials of the Three Realms array themselves to the left and right. Then, the *Five Stars General Incantation* is recited.

At the *Zhengzhong* hour of *Wu* (11 a.m.–1 p.m.), he contemplates the red *qi* emerging from the heart like rising clouds, encircling the altar hall. The Vermilion Bird and phoenix guard the front and rear. Jade lads and maidens, the true immortals of the Three Realms, the sun, moon, and stars, the Five Emperors’ great demons, the divine immortals of the ten directions, the troops overseeing the retreat, and the myriad spirit officials array themselves to the left and right. Then, the *Commanding Demon Gods Incantation* is recited.

At the *Rending* hour of *Hai* (9–11 p.m.), he contemplates the white *qi* emerging from the lungs like rising clouds, encircling the altar hall. The unicorn and White Tiger guard the four directions. Jade lads and maidens, the true immortals of heaven and earth, the sun, moon, and stars, the Five Emperors’ troops, the incense officials overseeing the retreat, and the officials of the Three Realms array themselves to the left and right. Then, the *Five Stars General Incantation* is recited again.

Closing his eyes, he inwardly contemplates the Five Peaks, the Five Perfected, and the Five Emperors guarding within his body. A golden radiance, like a canopy, suffuses his entire form, emerging from the lungs and rising behind the crown. A circular halo, like the sun, illuminates the ten directions, uniting inner and outer in profound harmony. Lions, phoenixes, unicorns, and white cranes—the Four Spirits and Eight Trigrams—array themselves in all directions. Auspicious clouds and auspicious *qi* encircle the altar grounds. The hosts of celestial beings and perfected ones gather in joyous assembly. Gazing upward, he beholds the Three Venerables of the Most High, seated in the splendor of the Heavenly Treasure. To the left are the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures; to the right, the Great Master of the Mysterious Center. All appears as if the heavens of a millet grain, with the myriad spirits in full attendance.

Next, he circulates his own *qi*, ascending to the *Niwan* (Mud Pill Palace). From one, it generates three; from three, it transforms into nine, forming a ninefold luminous orb that radiates across the ten thousand heavens. His true self ascends to pay homage to the Most Venerable. In his heart, he presents his petition, following the ritual protocols—nothing fails to evoke a response.

For all morning and evening Dao practices, this method is employed.

At night, the *Yeli Shifang* (Evening Rite to the Ten Directions) begins in the north, then proceeds to the northeast, east, south, and so on, following the order of the directions, including above and below. This reflects the principle of the myriad stars encircling the north, hence the first homage is paid to the north.

Entering the altar, he performs the *Jinghui Fu Shangdi Jue* (Purification Talisman for the Emperor of Heaven) and recites the *Tianmen Qi* (Heavenly Gate *Qi*) *Zhou Danghui* (Incantation for Dispelling Impurities):

*"Within the cavernous mystery, resplendent and vast is the Great Void.
The Three Clarities descend their decrees, their light illuminating the nine thoroughfares.
The mighty spirits of the eight directions enable my spontaneity.
By the Lingbao talismanic command, I universally announce to the Nine Heavens.
Qianluo Danna, the cavernous stem of the Great Mystery,
Slays demons, binds evil, and annihilates ten thousand ghosts.
The divine incantation of Zhongshan, the jade script of the Primordial Beginning,
Washes away impurities with mysterious water, repels ghosts, and extends years.
Following the script of the Five Peaks and Eight Seas,
The Demon Kings bow their heads, attending and guarding my chariot.
Malevolence and impurities dissolve; the Dao’s *qi* endures forever."*

The High Priest and assembly proceed to the curtain, kneel, and present the *Bai Tongzhen Biao* (Memorial for Communicating with the Perfected). Then, the memorial is recited and burned, along with the *Jinlou Yubi Shi* (Poem of the Golden Tower and Jade Steps).

The master visualizes within the altar hall five-colored auspicious clouds intermingling, merging with his own *qi* and ascending to the *Niwan*. It transforms into the Primordial Beginning, riding the radiance of a hundred treasures. In an instant, the Heavenly Worthy descends, merging into one. The great sagely beings of heaven and earth, the sun, moon, and stars, the Three Realms and ten directions, the thousand perfected and ten thousand sages—all ride upon wondrous light and gather at the altar.

The officiant visualizes their primordial spirit in the form of a perfected being, ascending the altar with the host of perfected ones from the Three Realms to pay homage, proceeding according to the ritual protocols.

The *Jinlou Yushi Fu* (Talisman of the Golden Tower and Jade Chamber) and the written memorial are transformed. The *Shenxiao qi* incantation is recited:

*"The Radiant Heavenly Emperor unites with sun and moon,
Auspicious qi swirls thickly, auspicious clouds densely spread.
The Three Flowers depart from the stem, the Five Lights open wide.
Jade chariots resound with Brahma-voices, jasper chambers hum with wondrous tones.
The forest of existence is purified by rain, the rain pool holds no mirror.
The golden city is firmly encircled, the jade grotto returns its numen.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!"*

**Proclamation of the *Jinlou Yushi Fu* (Talisman of the Golden Tower and Jade Steps):**
The *qi* of the Three Heavens and the jade script are memorialized and burned before the curtain.

**Chapter for Descending Perfected and Summoning Numinous Beings**
The master declares: *"The Celestial August’s Talisman for Descending Perfected Beings, the Talisman of the Void August for Summoning Numinous Perfected—these are the natural chapters of the flying mystery of the Three Heavens’ orthodox *qi*.*

*To descend the hundred perfected and subsequently summon the thousand numina, inscribe the talismans for descending perfected beings and the flying yellow script for summoning numina in cinnabar on seven feet two inches of green damask. *The heaven within heaven, vast beyond kalpas.*
*Within the primordial chaos, no darkness nor obscurity, no form nor shadow, no limit nor end.*
*The Brahmā-qi pervades the cosmos, myriad patterns unfolding.*
*Floating scenes of great auroras, ten revolutions returning the spirit, uniting with the root and merging with the perfected.*

**General Empowerment Incantation for Both Talismans:**
*The jade blossoms scatter their radiance, the nine qi congeal as mist.*
*Fragrant clouds densely woven, piercing straight to the nine heavens.*
*The golden youth attending incense and the jade maiden transmitting words convey my petition to the imperial presence.*
*May what I now declare be granted as spoken.*
*Hasten! As the Jade Clarity Numinous Treasure Immeasurable Salvation Statutes command.*

The talisman’s Left and Right Lords, golden youths and jade maidens, emerge from the two ears and eyes. Their attire is as usual, riding clouds of three plain hues, to convey my sincerity and intent, summoning the perfected and calling the numinous.

**The Resplendent Memorial to the Immortal Bureaus:**
The master says: These are the great celestial generals of the Jade Clarity Heaven, all subordinate to the Divine Duke of Jade Clarity, the Supreme Minister of the Great Mystery. Equal in merit to the great marshals of the heavens, they style themselves the *Resplendent Bureau of the Jade Clarity Numinous Treasure*. They assist Jade Clarity through kalpic transformations, subduing demons and sweeping away calamities, ascending and delivering the disciples of immortal learning. They inspect the Three Realms, expel malevolence, rigorously govern Fengdu, restrain wayward spirits, scrutinize demonic encampments, and purify the Dao’s domains—preparing the seed people of later generations to behold the Sagely Lord of Great Peace. All are the divine guardians who sweep and purge.

The Divine Duke is a minister of the Earthly Sovereign, heir to the Great Emperor of the Horse Ancestor, father of the Horned Dragon and Chen Constellation, holding the rank of Supreme Minister of the Great Mystery in Jade Clarity. His name is Guo Shuang, styled the Dragon of the Horse Ancestor.

The master forms the Jade Talisman with the left hand and the Highest Clarity Mudra with the right, transforming into the Divine Duke of Jade Clarity. Reciting the following incantation once, he traces the True Talisman of the Three Heavens at the celestial gate, inhaling the three hues from above and directing them through the crown gate to the Three Fields, merging the green, yellow, and white qi into three honored ones. Ascending to the Mud Pill, they unite with the three honored ones at the altar, blending into one. The adept’s true person, together with all the deities of the ten directions and Three Realms, collectively pay homage to the Supreme Emperor.

Next, form the Five Directions’ Mudra, harmonizing the qi of the five directions within and without. With the left eye, rotate three times and exhale, filling the ten directions. Bow and return to the altar, prostrating three times.

**Incantation for Summoning the Immortal Bureaus:**
*Above the lofty heavens, Jade Clarity presides.*
*The primordial net’s great pivot, the Mysterious Life Treasury.*
*Within it, the Imperial Lord and the Numinous Void Queen Mother.*
*Surrounding them, chanting and reciting, jade texts and golden talismans.*
*The Bureau of Immortal Prohibitions, golden youths and jade maidens.*
*Scrutinizing essence and subduing demons, governing the hundred officers.*
*Ascending to the Three Heavens, forming the Bureau of Manifestation.*
*Transmitting decrees and commands, dispelling calamities and rescuing suffering.*
*Guarding and protecting the Dao, imprisoning and binding demonic insults.*
*Wandering through the heavens, delivering the living and transcending the dead.*
*Dissolving misfortunes and crushing anomalies, communicating with the Purple Palace.*
*Proclaiming the ten directions’ mandates, summoning their respective lords.*
*Hasten! As the Highest Clarity’s Numinous Mandate and Primordial Beginning’s Supreme Emperor command.*

This incantation belongs to the Jade Clarity Numinous Treasure Palace, the inner court of the Numinous Treasure Celestial Immortals. The Immortal Bureaus descend from it to serve the immortals within the offices. For all summonings of the perfected and callings of the numinous, this incantation is indispensable.

**Talisman of the Jade Emperor’s Mudra of Ancestral Qi for Summoning the Perfected:**
**Incantation:**
*By the Jade Clarity’s decree, summon the thousand perfected and myriad spirits.*
*The Vast Sovereign’s precious register proclaims without cease.*
*The perfected and numinous obey the edict, acting upon the command.*
*Hasten! As the statutes command.*

**Talisman of the Jade Emperor’s Mudra of Ancestral Qi for Descending the Perfected:**
**Incantation:**
*The sacred mandate of Jade Clarity is proclaimed throughout the Three Realms.*
*The Heavenly Sovereign’s decree is universally announced to the Three Primes.*

The Boundless Sacred Hosts float through the void to arrive. *Hasten! As the statutes command.*

**Talisman of the Jade Emperor’s Mudra of the Celestial Gate’s Qi for Kneeling at the Censer:**
**Incantation:**
The Dao is studied through the heart, trust conveyed by incense.
Holding the jade censer, the heart abides in the Nine Heavens.
What your servant now petitions shall ascend before the Emperor.
*Each pays homage with the master’s mudra.*

First, visualize the form and name of the Scripture Master, and bow three times in the heart.
**Incantation:**
May the master attain the Dao of immortality, ascending to the lofty numinous.
For me, deliver all beings, that all may become perfected in the Dao, and my person ascend and transcend.

Next, visualize the form and name of the Register Master, and bow three times in the heart.
**Incantation:**
May the master attain flying immortality, ascending to the lofty perfected.
For me, deliver the seven generations of ancestors and parents, that they may swiftly be born in Heaven.
May I attain the true Dao and ascend into the formless.

Visualize the form and name of the True Master, and bow three times in the heart.
**Incantation:**
May the master attain ascension and transcendence, ascending to the lofty immortals.
For me, open the path through the Five Sufferings and Eight Difficulties, that my name be entered in the immortal register, and I forever become a perfected person.

The master says: The Dao of cultivation fundamentally lies in visualizing the master.
Without visualizing the master, from where could the Dao be obtained?
The one called the master is the Deliverance Master.
The master of the Deliverance Master is the Register Master, and the master of the Register Master is the Scripture Master—these are the Three Masters of the human realm.
There are also the Three Masters of Heaven: the Most High Lord Lao is the Deliverance Master, the Vast Sovereign of the Dao is the Register Master, and the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning is the Scripture Master.

Next, visualize the Three Masters of Heaven descending upon the green, yellow, and white qi, and bow three times in the heart.

**Mudra of the Five Directions’ Guardian Spirits:**
Follow the directions to press the mudras of *mao*, *wu*, *you*, and *zi* at the center. Internally visualize the five viscera, five mountains, five stars, and five emperors, each commanding their attendant officials, soldiers, and horses to guard within the body.
The Four Numinous Beasts stand in attendance, five-colored auspicious clouds suffuse the body, radiating directly to the five directions, enveloping the altar space, merging the inner and outer realms so that no resonance goes unanswered.

Xiaoren of Fusang, Fangzhu of rosy clouds.

Radiant with nine rays, harmonizing the qi of the Three Flowers.
The Heavenly Hoe brandishes its sword, the divine tiger repels evil.
The Great Emperor of Anyang commands and subdues the demonic hordes.
Ascend twice to Divine Aurora, bathing the form in the Heavenly River.

The Great Edict of the Primordial Heaven universally saves all beings.
Eradicate demonic trials, the flying fire bells flee.
Guard and protect the upright qi, long life through kalpas unending.
*Hasten! As the statutes command.*

*You* script, Western qi

Luxuriant brilliance transforms and intermingles, soaring through the ten directions.
